text: Somehow I never have had this. Fantastic cherry cider...almost mead hybrid. Nice real cherry flavor with floral honey and mild apple tartness. Just right.

500 mL bottle from Pourworks, Raleigh, NC. Pale yellow pour with a slightly pink hue (think something closely resembling Cherry 7-Up). Lightly carbonated but nearly still. Aroma of apples and tart fruit. Really nice apple taste, not too sweet, with a very welcome addition of cherry. Mild tart fruit lingers on the palate. An extremely well done cider.

12oz sample on tap at Sip in Plattsburgh. The aroma has light apple character present. Transparent white zin colored body with a weak light pink head. Starts with a mildly sweet honey like maltiness. Faint apple follows. Finishes with a little sweetness. Not really dry or flavorful, for that matter. Light mineral character. Just unexciting. I dont get the love for this.

Bottle shared with the KL tasting group. Poured a clear pink colour with little life. The aroma is sweet fake sugary fruit. The flavour is moderate sweet with a light grainy mineral sweet, cherry fruit palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.
Bottle from Market Street Wine Shop, Uptown. Pours pinkish. Aroma is tart cherries, apple. Flavor is a nice blend of sweet apple and tart cherry. Not the biggest cider fan, but this is pretty good.
Light, delicious, refreshing. Like cherry pie in a bottle. Soooo goooooodd

50cl Bottle @ The Beer Garden Store, Madrid, Spain.
Pale rose colour with no head.
Aroma is apple, honey, red fruits.
Taste is apple, honey, cherries, slightly tart and spicy.
Medium body, average carbonation.
Clear pinkish gold pour. Aroma is sweet and tart apple. Taste is sweet apple, a little cherry, and a slight tartness. Light and refreshing.
Süßer Antrunk nach Apfel und Kirsche. Spritzig, im Mittelteil trockener werdend, geringe Würzigkeit. Die Apfelnoten steigen an, sehr weich. Gut. 8/10/10/10/11/10
On tap at Tamarack Taproom. Reddish golden pour. Aroma is fresh apple cider. Taste follows, crisp apples, nice somewhat dry wine like finish. This is delicious.
Pours a clear bright pink. A strong sweet cider like aroma of apples and sugar. A sweet taste of apples, cherry, sour fruits and sugar. A lingering dry and sweet and sour fruit aftertaste.
Bottle thanks to Chad pours light pink color. High clarity. Medium light mouthfeel. Light cherry taste. Medium sweetness.

Aroma - cherries, golden apple, honey, and a smell that is hard to describe - slightly musty, and a bit of alcohol.
Appearance - the body is a clean vermilion amber. There isnt really any head development.
Taste - a crisp mix of cherry, honey, and golden apples.
Palate - body is light, the texture is slightly vinous and smooth, the carbonation is average, the finish is dry and fruity.

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. W zasadzie - spora niespodzianka. Jest miód, są wiśnie i kwasek, są jabłka. Niesamowicie pijalne, co przy tej cenie trudno nazwać zaletą ;)

Bottled. Cinnamon aroma and taste. Smooth with lots of cinnamon and a bit of apple. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Clear pink pour with the taste and aroma of cherries and apples. Slightly dry finish. Delicious!
16.9 oz bottle pours golden with a white head. Aroma and taste is apples, honey and cherry. Nice
Aroma is cherries, slightly mushy apples and mild fruit. The flavor is apples, mild cherries, fruit and a tart/slightly dry finish.
Bottle, Seattle. Thanks to Chris! Sweet, sour in the back. Doesnt smell like much. Feels like honey. Unidentified crisp flavor - cranberry?

Bottle in Seattle. Nice surprise from Chris in his monster box from a little while back, a nice thing to share with Julie (aka theporpoise). Clear, pale rose, no head. Sweet honey on the nose, a little tart red fruit. Natural sweetness, clean apple. Honey is a welcome note, rounds out the flavor and smoothes out the body. Clean, very tasty, just a hint of tart cherry. Solid.
From 16 Oz bottle many times. Pours light red with thin white head. Very effervescent. Nice tart cherry blends well with the crisp apple.

Bottle. Orange-pink, cloudy, light bubbles but nearly flat. Funky cider nose, quite English, apples, cherries, and a bit of barnyard. Wonderful cherry flavor, honey, apples, lightly spicy, stones. Prickly, tangy finish. Great stuff.
Light rosé color with foam ring. Red fruits tea and honey nose. Sweet cherry, fruity taste with caramel and honey and a laid back carbonation. Calm and little dry aftertaste.

500 ml bottle from Badger Spirits in Beloit, WI, sampled out of the fridge in a Konig Pils glass - pours lightly fizzy with a touch of immediately-dying foam, thick bubbles in suspension in the salmon-gold body...light oaky dry-tart apple aroma, a hint of smokiness or cigarette ash perhaps, pleasant but not particularly strong...body is much sweeter than the aroma might suggest, sweet all the way through with a honey syrupiness around the middle, some tartness developing then and going on towards the finish, but never really eclipsing the very juicy-sweet principal character...body is quite full, very light carbonation.  I dont find the cherry notes as strong as some other raters have, though they are present especially on the end.  Pretty enjoyable, though I think it becomes a bit too sticky as it warms.

Bottle from Erzbierschof Zurich. Lots of honey and cherry indeed, very little cider remaining. Tasty, fruity, sweet, intense. Heavy and strong, almost a sipper. Very low carbonation, but its not lacking at all. An impressive draught!

9/VII/16 - 1Pt. bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck (Vichte) @ home, Katie & Kevin tasting - BB: n/a (2016-737) 
Clear peach coloured cider, little bit of big bubbles, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: sweet, honey, floral, rose petals, very complex, bit fruity. MF: soft to no carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet start, floral, fruity, bit sourish, very very fruity, quite some cherries. Aftertaste: bit lemony, sourish, more cherries and floral notes. Holy hell, this is good stuff!

(bottle) clear pinkish golden colour with no head. aroma of vanilla and sweet apple juice, heavily dusty, with some notes of candied cherries, chestnut honey and band-aids. flavour is mostly apple juice, bubble gum and custard, rather sweet, with a touch of chlorine, some almonds and a semi-tart finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.
Bottle. Pink, light white lace. Nice Apple, light cherry/almond. Medium body, chewy - honey spice finish, a hint bratapfel, like a fruit pie. Nice balance, very pleasant.
Pink clear with no head. Aroma is white wine, cherries. Taste is complex. Cherries aplle everything very well balanced. Sour and sweet. Very nice.

Bottle, thanks anstei. Clear reddish-pinkish color with hardly any head. Aroma is cherry, honey, natural apples, funky, vanilla, tanninic. Taste is tart cherries, with a great honey balance and tannic apples with vanilla. Not dry, but also not sweet. Low natural carbonation. Awesome stuff.

Bottle 500ml.
Pours very clear salmon with no serious head. Aroma is of flowers, sugar, honey. Taste is of flowers, acidity, sugar. Palate: Medium body, soft-medium carbonation. Overall: Nice.

Bottle: Poured a clear dark golden color cider. Aroma of cherry flavours with light syrupy notes and plenty of residuals sugar notes. Taste is a sweet mix between cherry syrup notes with light apple flavours and quite a bit of residual sugar notes. Body is full with oily texture. Too sweet for my taste and not sure I really dig the cherry flavours.

Un cidre rose sans tête. Un nez intéressant de pommes, de fleurs de miel, de cerises aigres et finement douces. Un goût de vin rosé, de pommes et de miel avec une très alléchante et persistante touche de petits fruits rouges. La texture est plutôt souple, délicate, finement douce. La finale est épicée et fruitée. Tout à fait délicieux!

Pours a clear pink gold with low legs. Nose is of cherry lifesavers, plain and simple. Taste is lightly sweet with some good cider notes and cherries 
again. Honey sweetness without the honey flavors, I guess. Body and carbonation were moderate. A pretty nice sweet cider, different!

pours unclear light yellow, pink tint, with small bubbles. floral spicy honey, wildflower honey, tart red apples, chalk, sweetness - almost cloying; peach and fruit salad syrup, clean yeast action. moderately carbonation, medium body - very oily; sweet honey-citric finish. very nice blend of cider, "mead" and tart red fruit.

Bottle (500 ml) shared at tasting. Clear pale golden with reddish hues without head and much lacing. Aroma is very nice with cherries, cinnamon, candies, apples, mild honeyed notes and a bit of cough syrup. Taste is moderately sweet with tart cherries, honeyed notes, floral presence and cough syrup. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Tart and fruity finish. Very good tart cherry cider with a nice honey touch. Lovely.

Bottle shared. Clear gold pour with light salmon hue. Aroma is super fruity, cherry, rich cherry juice, honey, floral notes. Taste is sweet, floral, cherry juice and honey. Palate is med bodied with light carbonation, sweet. Surprisingly tasty, quite nice.
Drank at the Publik House in Chester, NJ. Pours a nice pink color with zero head. aromaas of apples. Tastes slightly of cherries, apple, slight honey flavor. A good Czizer.
Rosado limpio uniforme y espuma blanca que desaparece rápido. Aromas de cereza, uva, miel, manzana. Cuerpo ligero, sabor dulce de manzana y miel, final ligeramente seco.

Aroma is more Apple than honey, and more honey than cherry - though it comes out a bit as it warms. Color is red tinged dark golden w no head. Flavor is like a nice sweet and lightly tart apple cider blended with a New Glarus Belgian Red. Flavor definitely stood out and feel was refreshing. One of the better ciders, just wish it wasnt so expensive.

Light/medium earthy aroma of apple. Light golden color with no head. Clear liquid. Medium taste with artificial honey and apple. Simple with narrow taste spectrum and short after taste with apple. Light/medium body with medium carbonation. Overall, too light and artificial.

Tap (Alus Celle, Riga) at 5.5%
beautiful cinamoney honeyesque apple aroma. Taste matches that, more sweetness, but not sticky. Spicing perfect, not OTT, but making you ignore the slushy snow outside. Refreshing palate. So much sweet apple, lovely.

Small (1 or 2 oz.) pour, from a bottle, at Beer Dabbler Winter Carnival. Consumed on 2-6-16. Pours a pale, peach color with very little head. Nice shade of color. Floral, fruity aroma features scents of honey and cherry. Pleasant smell. Apple taste. Sharp yet quite sweet and floral flavor. Tart, especially in the finish; the finish also is dry. Theres something I dont love about the flavor. Thin body. Lively enough but insubstantial in the palate.

Bottle. Golden with a slight pinkish hue, peach colour with no head. Aroma of sharp apple and a hint of cherry. Taste is much deeper, apple, cherry, spice and honey. Sweet and clean. Goes down like fruit juice.

Clear, copper colored, no head. Aroma is of apple juice, lightly tart, cherries, some honey. Taste is medium sweet apple juice and honey, cinnamon, some cherry fruit, moderate to light tartness, dry finish. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, oily. Very tasty but more sweet and juicy than I like my ciders.
(bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)

Bottle from Cornelius. Clear rose body, no head. Low carbonation. Aroma of Turkish Delight, honey and fresh cherries. Flavour of crisp red apples, cherries and green Jolly Ranchers. Thin body with a sticky texture. Light fizz. Interesting but a bit too sweet for my palate.

Bottle from Systembolaget (privatimport). Fruity and flowery smell with berries and cherries. Sweet taste with cherries and flowers. Light and sweet. A bit artificial, like they used cherry juice or extract rather then real cherries. But I liked it.
Bottle at home. Pours pale pink, nose is tart apple, light honey, taste is juicy fruit, sweet.

Poured from a 16oz bottle, gifted from neighbors. Appearance is a clear coppery color with a thick and frothy head. Aroma is strong notes of sour apple, tart cherry, and fresh honey. Taste follows the nose, and the honey comes out well, but also with apples and cherries. Balanced nicely between sweet and sour. Palate is thin. Overall, very nice cider for what it is.

On tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a pale pink with a fizzy, white, short lasting head. Aroma has lots of cherry, cherry blosson, apples, lavender, honey, fruity acid, slight leather. Taste is medium sweet, fairly floral, juicy with lots of cherry and apples, pretty acidic. This is a great soda. High carbonation and light, juicy texture. Dry finish. One of the better ones
Tap. Clear pink color and no head. Sweet and sour cherry and apple. Rich carbonation makes it almost geuze-like.

Pours clear coppery with a thick and frothy, though effervescent, eggshell head. Aroma presents strong notes of sour apple, tart cherry, and fresh honey. Sweet honey comes forth more strongly in the flavor, but apple and cherry are still present and pucker- worthy. Sweet and sour balance very nicely. Texture is firm, smooth and fizzy, good for a mead. This will get you in the mood for zombie slaying.
Clear orange with a reddish hue. Aroma is honey, light cherry, light green apple. Flavour is light mead, cherry is light too, some apple juice in the after taste. Overall nice and refreshing.
All In Beerfest 2015: Aroma of cherries, apples and candy. Taste is dark blood red sour cherries with red sweet apples. Honey and lemon, a dry sensation of cherry pips.
From the bottle came a very nice brew with no head. Wonderful aromas and flavors of honey, cherry, and slightly sour apple.
Bottle from recent trip to CLE. Blush, looks like an orange wine. Smells dry and fruity and a little musty. Nice and light.
Bottled. Poured a pale pinkish color. No head. Slightly bubbly at first. Aroma is a sweet cherry. Tart cherry taste. Almost reminds me slightly of a sweet cherry wine. Not too bad.

Backlog rating. Keg at CBC Covent Garden, London. It pours a clean rich golden color with almost no head. Aroma is sweet cherry honey yoghurt flowers melon. Taste is also sweet with melon honey apricots sweet cherries. Medium to full bodied with almost no carbonation. Overall, tasty

Shortlived, pinkish head, settling to a stunning flamingo-red drink, lazily bubbled. Fruity nose with apple, cherry and some faint mediterranean herbs. Bit vinous. Apple, sourish, sweetish and fruity. Red berries, again an idea of wine - Rosé dAnjou? - if sweeter. Titillating MF, light, could well be refreshing with a little less sweetness. Like it actually. Maybe I shouldnt ,but I do...

UPDATED: APR 10, 2016 Pours brilliant red with no head. Visually medium rising bubbles. Aroma is one of the best parts: strong note of cherries, with hints of apples in the background. 
Flavor is firstly sweet, but immediately transforms to slightly tart, with dominant note of cherries and hints of apples. 
In comparison with Negromangocon is too onedimensional. But still dangerously drinkable.
On their official webside is presented as Cider and not as MEad.
KRS 140315. Peachy colour with a small white head. Aroma is apple, honey, cherries. flavour is sweet, honey, floral, cherries, apple. Weird in a good way.
Amazing Mead! Im surprised I havent rated it by now since Ive drank it so much. One of the best meads there is.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2015 Aromat: intensywne jabłka, miód i wiśnie. 
Wygląd: barwa różowa, klarowne, kiepska piana.
Smak: na początku sporo słodyczy w postaci zielonych i lekko kwskowatych jabłek oraz miodu i wiśni, na finiszu wytrawność. 
Tekstura: średnie pełne, umiarkowane nasycenie. 
Ogólne wrażenie: pyszny, aromatczny miód pitny, któego smak świetnie uzupełnia się z wisniami i jabłkiem,, niesmowicie pijalny.
Pours a pale pink with some effervescence. Aroma is cherry and apple. Flavor is tart cherry, apple, and some sweet honey. Very enjoyable.

Tap at the source. Light Pink, no head. Aroma is apple and cherry, sweet syrup. Flavor is sweet cherry. Like cherry soda almost, but those apple notes are there. Pretty cool stuff. Pretty effervescent. Couldnt drink a ton, but its good.

Problem mam z tym trunkiem. wyglądał i pachniał jak kompot wieloowocowy, wyraźna wiśnia, jabłko i zaledwie nutki miodu na granicy autosugestii. W smaku miód wyraźniejszy, wytrawna wiśnia, spora soczystość, ale totalny brak pełni, lekka kwaskowość, niskie wysycenie, skojarzenia z winem różowym. Pijalne i orzeźwiające, owszem, ale piłem już cydry z większą pełnią.

Pours a blush from a bottle, very little carbonation, smells like real apple pie should, actually more like apple/cherry. Flavors shine through of good sweet/tart apple, and tart cherries. Very good mead.
Amber clear with almost no head. Sweetsour aroma. Strong juicy fruit sweetsour taste (apples, cherry)
On tap at Delirium Village in Brussels. Looks like rose wine - rose and very transparent. Tastes more like beer, having the bitter notes and sweet at the same time
Pink colour, no head. Aromas are sweet cherries, honey. Not so sweet on the tongue, cherry heavy with honey notes, quite awesome.
UPDATED: APR 20, 2017 B. Pours a coral color with white head. Apple cider with flavors of cherry and honey.

Rated on 6-14-2015 (Bottle) The appearance is a small head, transparent golden body and fast rising carbonation. The aroma is sweet, honey, light apple, and cherries. The flavor is sweet, honey, apple, light tart cherries, and finishes dry. The mouthfeel is smooth and this mead is medium bodied. A quaffable and easy drinking mead.

Sampled from a 16/oz brown bottle this cider poured an orange-caramel color with a trace soapy white head that faded quickly and left no lacing. The aroma was sweet honey, tart cherry and faint apple. The flavor was sweet apple, honey, cherry and nutmeg. Long finish. Medium body. well done.

Bottle from a Liquor store in Glen Rock. Appearance: Pours clear, pinkish gold with some orange. Aroma is honey with a hint of sourness. Taste of honey, sour cherry, faint apple. While it starts sweet, when allowed to sit on the tongue, it is more sour. More apple in the finish than in the beginning with light taste of alcohol. Sweet but there is enough sour cherry to make it non-cloying. Quite drinkable and quite refreshing as they noted. IF the aroma was as complex as the taste, Id probably give it around a 4.1/4.2. Nice though

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a head of frothy fine to medium sized white colored bubbles that were very quickly diminishing and left behind a very softly carbonated transparent orange colored body and a oily lacing. The mild aroma was honey. The crisp mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish. The nice flavor contained notes of honey and cherry. An OK brew just nothing special.
Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer. Pours light golden color with nice effervescence. Aromas of sweet cherry juice honey and a hint of apple. Taste is tart and crisp.

500 ml bottle shared by Willrunforbeer, during this Grand Mead tasting. Light rose color mild carbonation. Aroma is weak cherry juice, apples, mild honey. 
Flavor shows aspirin, light tart cherry juice, light sugar. Body is thin with a watery texture. Carbonation is average with a weak tart aftertaste.
500mL bottle. Pours pinkish white gold with tiny white bubbles. Aroma is tart cherry, honey, apple. Flavor is somewhat dry with dry cherry honey and apple.
50 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear pinkish golden with an off-white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are cherries, honey, and apples - with a dry finish.

Pink in color like a cherry 7UP, mild carbonation but not overly annoying. Touches the tongue very sweet and finishes dry - A nice combination.  I didnt really notice the honey, but the cherry was there.

Aroma is sour cherries, some sweet honey, mild nectary notes as well as some sour apple as well. Flavour is slight sweetish sour notes, where the cherries, honey, mild spiciness as well as apples mix together rather nicely. In a way refreshing, although the honeyish floral notes tend to be a bit sweet.
Draft at the craft beer festival , beer at the pier in the south street seaport. Light pinkish color with a nice sweet apple flavor. Almost like a sour. Very good

On tap. Slightly expensive. It was $7 for 7oz. Bright pink body. Looks and feels more like wine. Big tart cherry taste with a nice sweetness from the honey. This was very good. Probably the best mead Ive had, although I havent had many.
Really apple cidery. Extra sticky sweet with the honey. Taste is sweet like dessert, but otherwise this is nothing special.

Bottle from Beer Frog cons 2015-05-10 Spring Hill, FL
AR: apple cider (semi dry), French cheese (the smell went away after 5 sec, you have to be quick), honey
AP: rosé wine colored body, wee semitransparent white disappering head
F: fresh semi dry apple cider, rich and intensive carbonation, german kriek, wee honey cumb, dry finish
Sample at CBC 2015. Hazy golden colour. Aroma and tasteof honey, mead, apple, floral, tart, very sweet taste.

Pours pale pink. Very nice and fruity. Crisp and sweet apple taste. Refreshing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I feel like I am getting a buzz on Apple juice. Its not terrible but pretty good as far as meads go.
Hazy golden colour. Aroma of honey, mead, hint of wood, apple, floral notes. Flavour of honey, sweet apple juice. Sweet finish, honey, apple. (from draught @ Taphouse, København visit 2014)
Peach fuzz pour. Aroma of apples, cherries, spices, flavor is fantastic, apples, honey, fruit. Smooth, fresh mouthful, not too sweet.
Bottle 50 cl. Pours a clear amber with a white head. Cherry in the nose. Rich, sweet body, spicy honey accents and a thick cherry note. A little late tartness. 270315
On tap at drinking bird. Absurdly sweet. Not getting much cherry here. Just really sweet cider flavor. Mediocre.
500ml bottle. Pours clear reddish-pink. Aroma of cherry, honey, and Apple. Tastes cherry forward balanced by mild honey and Apple. Slight carbonation. One of my favorite cysers.

Bottle. It pours a clear dark pinkish golden body with a few bubbles on top. Almonds and cherries in the aroma, very flowery. The flavor is semi-sweet, with lots of fruityness, apples doing more than the cherries. Some almond, honey and honey in the flavor. Medium to thin on the palate. Long fruity finish. A nice one, almost sessionable, but its too sweetish for my sweet tooth. 150314

Bottle 500ml @ Geokkjer
Pours clear deep golden with a few off-white bubbles. Aroma has notes of honey, floral, cherries and green apples. Taste is medium sweet with a long apple, cherry, honey and floral finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. Pours deep golden with a tiny off-white head, Aroma of honey, very floral, perfume and cherries. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some honey, cherries, sugar and other berries. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Aromas of baked apples, mild cinnamon, subtle cherry, subtle red berry, cranberryesque, some clove. Clear copper-gold. Somewhat sweet, slightly spicy, refreshing fruity notes. Light-medium bodied, a little sticky.
Nice. Pink coloured and clear. No head. Fruity, pear, apples and marzipan. Sweet with notes of cookies.
Bottle. No head. Peach colour. Moderatre cherry/kriek aroma. Some Honey present. Average Honey flavor. Week cherry notes. Average finish. Oily palate.
If you rounded up everything thats good about wine added some co2 and like a billion time more deliciousness..... Yeah its pretty awesome. B nektar cant really do wrong...
Refreshingly sweet (but not too sweet), evenly spiced, with the tartish cherry coming through really well.

Tasted on 1/4/12. Pours clear brassy golden with a thin white head that quickly disappears, leaving nothing. The nose is honeyed apple cider, cinnamon, and sweet/tart cherry. The flavor is a little sweeter cherry with some tartness, honey apple, and cinnamon. The body is medium with fizzy carbonation and a long, sweet/tart cherry, apple, and cinnamon finish.
Light orange/pink color. ARoma and taste of apple, slight cherry and some honey. Light and drinkable.
nice sweet Honey aroma,red, orange, clear, white foam, medium sweetness, sweet cherry and nice fresh finish

Bottle. Hazy peach orange cyser with no head. Aroma is fruity with notes of apples, cherries, funky yeast, floral honey and oak. Flavor is fruity with notes of apples, cherries, honey and flowers. Well balanced.
Bottle. Amber colour with virtually no head. Aroma is honey. Sweet flavor. Creamy palate.

Yes ! another awesome mead of B. Nektar... i love this stuff ! 
schenkt mooi oranje/roze uiteraard kraagloos. Aroma is die van een lekkere appel, honing, kersen en fris zuurtje... Smaken zijn redelijk zoetig, appeltjes zurig, matig kruidig. matige body, glad van textuur, en lage co2.... wederom een lekkere frisse mead, echter wel wat minder uitgesproken dan de necromangocon, die was werkelijk héérlijk

31-DEC-2014, bottle @Heidi, from Kihoskh.
Hazy orange with no head. Aroma is marzipan and cherry. Taste is cherry and honney. Sweet, touch of tartness. Nice, very soft carbonation. Lovely.

Beautiful pink color with a one finger head, quickly dissipating down to next to nothing. Smells awesome with tons of cherry skin, granny smith apples and light honey sweetness. Taste is pretty much the same with lots of cherry and everything else offering some balance. Overall this is definitely one of their better meads.

Bottle via Levi from way back when. Thanks as this has been sitting in my fridge for a year or more. Poured with friends that stopped by. Pours a light yellow to a slight pink with no head. Slight bubbles. Aroma is vanilla and white wine. Taste is slightly sweet at the front with some cherry, loads of apple on the finish and a slight bitterness to finish it. Very nice and refreshing.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Pink color without head. Aroma has notes fo cherries and slightyly honey. Flavor is slightly sweet, with green apples hints and a good presence of cherries. Sweetness in the final.

Clear pink body with a very similar appearance to a rose champagne. No head and fizzy. Aroma is cherries, apples, honey. Taste is ciderish. Sweet and a slight tart finish. Really refreshing and just about the right amount of sweetness for me.

Bouteille 50cl.
De couleur rosâtre-cuivrée, léger trouble sur la fin, pas de col.
Arôme met nettement plus en avant le côté pomme que de miel. Petit pointe de cerise avec un rétro de pomme caramélisée.
Palais proche du cidre rappelant un léger cidre de glace. Le côté cerise est léger sans pour cela prendre grande part au caractère, cela va de même pour le mielleux. Pointe de tanin de pomme pour une effervescence moyenne voire haute au fini sec.

Draft. Honey and apple aroma. Hints of cinnamon.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle from Mikkeller webshop. Pours a clear orangey salmon pink colour, shortlived white foam head and aroma of honey, sweet apple, cherry marzipan note. Taste is sweet, honeycomb, fruity apple & cherry, light woody. Slightly syrupy mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, quite clean finish with some lingering light cherry. Nicely drinkable.

How: Bottle.
Where: NK Bar, Stockholm.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Honey, apples, fruit.
Body: Medium body, flat carbonation.
Flavour: Apples, honey, cider.

Cloudy orange color, thin white head that quickly disappeared. Aroma of cherries, apple and some tartness. Taste is... wow... honey, apples, cherries, wood. Nice combination of sweetness and sourness. Easy and very refreshing. I would drink this all day if I could.

Light orange and pink, and a bit hazy, but looks good. Smells like sweet cherries, and paired with some tart apple, this is definitely a nice drink. Finishes crisp with a bit of tart on the end. Really good!
Murky orange pour to this sweet fruit punch. I think it is what they were shooting for, bit to sweet for me.
Bottle from Bursprak. Many thanks! Light pink/orange colour, white foam. Medium carbonation. Sweet aroma of honey, green apples and red fruit. Sweet with light tart notes. Easy drinkable. Good.

Poured from a bottle into a flute glass. The appearance is clear with a dark gold color. The aroma is light, fruity, and not really sweet smelling. Fine bubbles give it a light mouthfeel. Taste is crisp and fruity, but not overly sweet like many meads. This is quite enjoyable and could easily be sessionable.

Paired with an episode of the Walking Dead. Bottle from a small liquor shop in Chicago near Wringley Field. Served in a stemmed glass. 6% the color is a pinkish hued gold with a wisp of white fizz as a head that vanishes instantaneously. A bit wine like in the nose with honey, cherry, cinnamon, hints of apples and somewhat of a rose vibe to the aroma. Medium bodied, frikin delicious flavor - tart cherries, sour apples, cinnamon, honey sweet but with a zombie chomping bite to it. The best mead Ive ever had and it makes me want to seek out more mead~! Damn this is good!
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar. Pours clear dark gold-amber with a thin white head. Aromas of pear, slight cherries, apples. Taste is more tart up front, sweet cherries, green apples, pear cider.

500 ml bottle purchased a year ago at Holiday Wine Cellar ($9.99). Pours an interesting pinkish-amber hue with a very thin layer of white-ish foam with champagne-like effervescence that quickly dissipates into nothingness. AROMA of both tart and sweet cherries, semisweet apple cider, with hints of sweet honey and spice. FLAVOR has much of the same with cherries at the forefront along with the apples and honey and spice more in the background. Really nice mixture and balance of the tart and the sweet, with the spice as a nice complement. Im not very familiar with this style and seems to be at least as much cider as mead. Not particularly complex overall, but extremely quaffable and actually quite refreshing on a hot San Diego day in October. (455, 920)

Bottle @ De Molen Beershop. Pours clear golden with bubbles fading. Very complex and interesting nose and flavor. Cherries, flowers, apples, blossom and honey. Sweet and vinous but quite refreshing with a mild tart bite - balanced. Slick. Delicious!
Sampled at Northgate Tasting. 3rd mead ever. Im sorry for the useless comment, but I just dont know how to rate these yet. Going with my gut on how it speaks to me. These are all weird to me.

Tap. Pours a cristal clear golden with a whit head that disappears completely in no time once poured. Aroma is apple juice, tart cherries with and only a subtle honey. Reminds my of cherrie sauce. Taste is medium not very sweet for the style. Apple juice with a crisp cherry finish. A slight tart dryness too. So drinkable!
UPDATED: FEB 7, 2015 incredible cider! has a buttery melow smooth apple flavor. you have to try this cider. It is incredible.

500mL bottle. Clear rose gold color with big bubbles. Smells like dry, tart apple, ripe cherries and honey - exactly as advertised. An initial fruity honey sweetness with a nice medium tartness. Watery body with a fizzy feel.
The cherries and honey make this different than your typical cider. Quite tasty!
Poured from a bottle it is a lovely blush color with no head. The aroma is tart cherry and the taste is sweet cherry with a light finish that resonates on the palate
From a16 oz bottle shared at home. Pours a clear pinkish gold with a scant white head. Aroma of cherries. Flavors of honey, apple and sweet cherries. Tasty with a sweet finish.

Pours a hazy amber. Aroma of cherries, cider and citrus. Flavor is very fruity and tart. Cherry, apple, some spice, and a nice hint of raw honey in the background. I greatly enjoyed this. The only downside is the price - $9.99 per 500ml.
Die Farbe ist blass orangegelb, Schaum ist nich vorhanden. Geruch nach Kirschen und Äpfeln. Geschmack fruchtig süß nach reifen Äpfeln und etwas Kirsche.
Bottle. Pours a super transparent reddish amber. Aroma of cherries with some crisp alcohol notes. The balance in the taste is welcomed, fruit and alcohol.

Not my personal style but good. Strong apple flavor. Cherry comes in at the back end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at the Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, red session. 03/05/2014. Attractive pink / orange rose wine looking pour. Aroma is bursting with fresh fruit, peach, blackcurrent, honey and carbonation. Flavour is crisp apple, tangy berry, fresh fruit, some rubber. Palate is semi-sweet refreshing, decent carbonation.

Bottle shared. Pours slight hazy pinkish golden brown with no head. Aroma of sweet apples, perry, cherries, spices, cinnamon and nutmeg and rhubarb. Flavor is over moderate sweet. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Lovely!

60cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
No head or carbonation. Hazy pink pour. Quite sweet with some cherry tartness. Very nice

Bottle poured. Pink in color with no head. Sour apple, cherry and honey aroma. Sharp cherry and apple flavor with a hint of honey in the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Pollen, honey and berry aroma. Pale pink. Sweet-tart honey and cherry flavor. Very nice.

500 ml bottle. Unclear pink/orange body practically whiteout any head. Aroma is more berries and fruit than honey, but there is a faint hint of honey here. Flavor is like a sweet cider with cherries and oranges. Some acidic berries but still too sweet for me. Quite refreshing served cold but the lack of honey flavor was a bit of a disappointment for me. Too sweet and sticky like soda pop after a while.

Keg at Cask P&K. Clear pinky orange, slight haze, no head, lightly sparkling. I lost my notes on this but from memory the aroma is sweet musty fruit, apple cider. Taste is very sweet yet a little dry, foxes glacier mints, cinnamon. A little one-dimensional.

Aroma: cider, apples, cinnamon, honey. Appearance: clear peach, no head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: sweets exploding, apples, cider, sweet fruits. Overall: nice Mead, fruity aroma and palate. Pint at Cask Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Smaller sized lively and fairly quick disappearing white head.
Leaves a headless rose (wine) looking Mead. After a while it turns more orange. Wtf?
Aroma of dusty apple, dusty cellar, some light hints of dusty cherries, cabbage, cinnamon and honey.
Flavour of apples, dusty apples, some cinnamon, bit fruity, again dusty cellar and something that tastes a bit like wilder yeast, light cherry tones, some fruity tartness and some appel and pear peel.
Aftertaste is apple juice, light bitter & tart ish apples, some subtle dry hints and some years and malts...
Low carbo, creamy to watery mouthfeel, medium bodied and a light dry light watery texture. Very nice, refreshing, interesting and easy!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
pretty good, but pretty sweet. The sweetness settled quickly. Lots of cherry flavor. If you're a fan of Dogfish Head Noble Rot, give this a shot.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

"They should of called this love potion number nine".I was at the store selecting a couple of brews to enjoy this hot summer day and thought wow what a cool label , Ill give it a shot and glad I did. Very refreshing pleasant earthy aromas of cherry and "think of me as crazy" but earthy mushrooms is in the nose. Its sweet and tart and a great refreshment for enjoying at the river or lake or just hanging by the pool side . Try it if you like wine coolers cause its bomb.
Bottle thanks to Brian. Pours a clear pink orange with no head. The aroma is strong cherry skin, oak, pears. Thin mouthfeel with cherry, pears, and oak. Easy to drink, very impressive.

I am excited to try this because all the other B. Nektar meads have been novelty spiced garbage but people still like them. A more straight ahead fruit based one seems like it might be more up my alley--and it is. This is a pretty decent beverage. It is clear and headless. It is pretty single-mindedly cherry oriented but it has a nice, fresh, juicy taste that reminds me somewhat of New Glaruss fruit beers. It tastes like cherry juice dissolved in a sweet hard cider and that is basically exactly what it is. My only complains are that there is really not much honey character--maybe just a floral note around the edges--and I feel like the apple juicy texture would be improved if this were more effervescent. It finishes with some lingering sweetness and green apple tartness and overall is a nice, fresh , fruity tasting drink. I would definitely recommend this for those who enjoy beers w/ lots of real fruit flavor. It is not the most subtle stuff in the world but does a great job of being what it is.

500ml bottle. Pours peachy orange with low carbonation. Aroma is sweet cherry, apple and nail polish. Taste is cherry to start with a cherry and apple finish. Tastes like a macro fruit cider for kids to get pissed up on.

Tap. Clear rose pink redish color. No head, flat. Fruity, elderberry, sweet, sourish, cherry in aroma. Elderberry and cherry written all over the taste. nice and crisp. Perhaps little bit too sweet. Sour cherry in aftertaste.

Pours clear orange-pink with no head. Aroma is sour cherries, apples, faint honey, minerals and sweet flowery notes. Flavor is sour and sweet, honey, apples, cherries, feels somewhat cider like. Finish is rather watery and sour with hints of alcohol. Overall: very delicious.

Bottle courtesy of "AKFaust". Past notes. Colour...much like a Provence rose but of course, effervescent. Nose...delightfully bright and spritely with masses of tart cherry, vanillin, clover honey and rose petal. Palate...crisp, bright and eminently appealing with tartly sweet cherry at the forefront and all around the palate. Apple and quince hit mid palate and essence of honey focuses itself towards the ever fresh and vibrant finish. Truly wonderful stuff that I wish we had in Oregon!

Tap. Clear reddish orange, small head that quickly dissipates. Nose is cherries, apples, honey, tartness. Flavor is pretty close to what it smells like, fruit, cherries and honey dominate, a nice hit of tartness and spice in the finish.
On tap at Pudel, Tallinn. Clear slightly pinkish with no head. Fruity aroma with apples and cherry. Sweet, but balanced with nice acidity. Refreshing and dangerously drinkable.

Pours pale pink with no head. Aroma is sweet floral honey, fruity and light tart cherries and apples. Taste is sweet with a fruity touch, finish has some light apple and cherry tartness. Medium bodied
An extremely well-crafted mead that has a taste that alternates between the sweet and sour of the cherries, apples and honey. The layers were quite satisfying. Enjoyed on tap at Sugar Maple, MKE, WI.
Bottle share thanks to Richthevillan at tasting. Pale pink mead with carbonation. Aroma of cider apples and some honey. Taste follows suit with some sherbet. Ok mead.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; clear fizzy pink pour, fruit cider aroma, taste has honey, apple, cherry, lemon curd, quite a thin texture.

This is an odd brew. Poured clear light red almost pink without a single trace of head or lace. Taste is tart, cherry, apple, spice and sugar. Mostly tastes like a sweet cider. Alcohol is disguised very well. Flavor is sweet but it is balanced. Light body.

Generously shared by one of the fine Portland RB folks at a tasting - Wow, this exceeded expectations. Pours light pink with no head. The aroma has soft flower petals, gentle apple, hints of cherries and gentle herbs. It has a medium velvety smooth body with no carbonation. IT begins with floral / petals, apples, cherries, jasmine, honey sweetness and a balance to everything. The finish adds a touch of spice and super-balance softness lingering. Excellent mead.

Draft. Clear red/pink body. Short white head, quickly diminishing. Aroma of apples, honey, berries, cherry. Flavors of crisp apples, cherry, sweet fruits. Light tartness in the finish. Medium body, watery texture, moderate carbonation. Low on complexity, but high on enjoyment. Easy drinking without being cloying or overly fruity.
UPDATED: NOV 23, 2015 Aroma of apples, sweet cherry, honey. Flavour is quite sweet with some tart apples in the finish. Im not much of a fan of this kind of drink, but I found this one fairly okay.

500 ml bottle split two ways. Pinkish pour with no head whatsoever. Nose has honey, green apples and sweet cherries. Taste has tart cherries, tart lemon juice, sweet honey and some green apple skin. Very refreshing and good!
Smell is sweet fruit, appearance is orange pink, taste is sweet tart apple and cherry, havent had many meads but if they are like this one I will have to try more.
Hazy light orange no head. Sour and sour syrup. Taste is sour apple with sweet funky cherries. No bitterness.

At first I was sceptical for this low ABV in mead, but then.. Well its quite good. Decent honeyish background, pleasantly fruity, almost like cider  apples, cherries, some interesting spices. Quite light and refreshing. Mostly sweet. Decent, but nothing fancy

initial aromas and indeed my first taste were very positive. Rarely do I encounter apples, other fruit, and honey character so balanced and expressive. Cherries? heck yes. Apples? of course! Honey? Indeed! I even noticed the star thistle varietal. 
However, the admonition to "drink cold, zombies hate the cold!" is very true. It took only a few degrees of warmth, and the loss of the initial spritz of carbonation, before this went cloying on the palate. Too sweet. By my second bottle I had started drinking it ice cold, poured a few ounces at a time into a chilled glass, with the remainder stoppered in the fridge. Kinda silly to have to go to that extent to be able to finish a bottle; would love to see this in an off-dry form.

Cherry alike, sourish ... lemonade or cider! Weird, Im more beer liker :)
Pours pale amber to orange with no top. Aroma - sweet-cider, cherries, and a bit like sour ales acid (moments glue), liked it a lot. Taste - sweet, a light sour and no hops - why is there no hops?!? Medium body, cider or compote texture. Interesting, but for that price I prefer Beer. Interesting cider like drink. From mead style I had tasted better.

Draught @ CBC2014. Pours crystal clear orange with a tiny bubbly head. Aroma is very sweet with honey, cherry, fruit, brett. Taste is moderate+ sweet and moderate tangy. Body is medium, texture is fat oily, carbonation is perfect - according to my notes. Finishes sweet and tangy with tart apple in the late finish. Not complex but achieves a great balance and drinkability. Quite nice.
Draught at CBC 2014. Clear amber colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, spice, honey, oranges and some bitterness.
On tap at CBC 2014. Clear dark golden with no head. Aroma and taste is sweet and fruity; honey, orange, spice and some bitter notes.

Draught at Taphouse, København. Clear red/amber - no head. Sweet fruity. Orange. Apple. Spicy notes some bitterness. Light honey notes. Lovely freshness. High drinkability. Light sweetness LIght to medium red sour cherries.

Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. 1st Session. Pours pink vinous to pale orange with no head, aroma of wine, peaches, honey and floral notes, flavor of peach, honey and perfume, medium to full bodied, nice.
Tap @ CBC14-yellow. Pink, light colour. Apple cidery nose. Slight honey. Sweetish medium full body. Nice soft, honey finish.

[5/2/14] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration. 1st session. Pinkish orange color. Aroma of apples, a bit of honey and some cherries. Sweetish-sourish flavor with apples, some honey, a bit floral, some cherries and a sugary touch. Very good and refreshing.

Pours a clear pink gold with a thin beige head and a layer of bubbles sticking to the inside of the - clean- glass. Aroma of Cherry Ludens, sweet apple, earth and spicy and floral notes. Flavor is sweet and lightly tart apple, something reminiscent of Pink Lady, very nice, smooth honey notes, nice pie spice, slightly tart cherry and a light minerality to the finish. Light body, juicy to dry and pleasantly acidic feel and medium, sharp carbonation. Simply delicious and all around very enjoyable.

Sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. Very pale reddish pink. Barely any head. Lovely tart cherries in both aroma and taste. Fresh, ripe fruit and the honey coming through as well. Just a gentle and delicious pleasure, and one of surprises of the festival for me.
Bottle. Reddish pink color with no head. Aromas of sweet apple, cherry and honey. Nice tart cherry/apple flavor with a hint of honey in the finish. This stuff is killer.

Sweet fruity, berries, apples, honey, lovely stuff.
Bottle - Cherry and honey. Light pink no head. Honey, apple and cherry. Much like an alcohol based juice/cider. Still nice though.

Golden blush color out of the bottle and mostly still. Big honey nose with some musty fruit and a lot more alcohol than the 6% would indicate. Great honey sweetness with strong apple flavor and a puckering cherry tartness. Very nice mead.

Draught at CBC 2014.
Clear yellow coloured with a red gleam and a small white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of honey, marzipan and berries.
Fruity flavour of honey, berries and marzipan.
Sweet finish.

Draught at CBC 2014. Clear light pink liquid with a small white head. Aroma of honey, cherries, red berries and fruit. Taste is medium sweet with notes of honey, cherries and sugar. Medium bodied with low carbonation. Really nice.

Shared by neepsntatties. Thanks! 

A: Pale blossom color. Still and placid.

N: Apple, honey, rubber, sugar, floral elements. Sweet cherries, cinnamon, more apple. 

T: Sweet, then sour like a Honeycrisp Apple. 

M: Sticky and medium-heavy. 

O: A mixture of cider and honeywine I find rather incredible. Has the best of both worlds, and I want more.

Aroma is an odd mix of bitter beer and apple juice. Not a bad smell, but just a little weird for a mead. Taste is heavy on the sparkling apple juice. Similar in mouthfeel and taste to a Martinellis Sparkling Cider. You can easily chug this mead due to the pleasant sparkling texture and the low ABV. Notes of cherry and honey, although the honey is barely there. Heavy tart apple taste at the end which was a bit weird and kind of like the smell, but it goes away quickly. Didnt care for that part of it, but overall its great and very drinkable going down.
At CBC. Clear pink colour with white head. Honey, fruity, wine aroma. Honey, fruity, wine, apple taste. Medium body.

500 ml bottle from Mikkeller & Friends. Hazy orange red and golden. No head. Delicious aroma of apples, honey and cherries. Soft and very fruity. Fairly low carbonation level, but very refreshing. Nice acidity level. Lovely fruity flavours. Really well balanced and very drinkable. Love it.

Tap at a recent RB tasting... Poured pale, straw/pinkish with a thin head. This was nice stuff. Dry, mildly tart apple juice tones with honey sweetness. Easy drinking and refreshing. Could crush a ton of this on a hot day.
Sampled @ CBC 2014. Very pale peachy color, small white head. Aroma is sweetness, sugary, apple, pear. Taste apple, pear, mainly sweetness and sugar. Too sweet and sugary for my liking.
rose wine looking appearance with a finger white head. smells like a dry white wine. really amazing. apples and peaches with pears as well. ultra sweet taste, peppermint and lots of pears with honey.

Sample at CBC 2014. 

Amber with a small head. Sweet aroma of cherries, honey and apples. The taste was very sweet with honey, apples and some cherries. The body was light. A tasty Mead.
Draught CBC 2014. Pink coloured. Unclear. Whitish head. Aroma. Cherries, sweetness, flowers, honey. Flavour. Honey sweetness, tart, cherries. Medium bodied. Ends tarish and full of berries.

Tap @ taphouse, Cph. Pours clear golden with no real head. Aroma has apple, honey, floral, soft alcohol. Medium carbonation, fat and kinda oily mouthfeel. Flavour has lots of fat sweetness, honey, apples, light zesty. Very elegant.

Tap @ Taphouse. Pours a clear orange beer without any head on top. Aroma of apple, honey, pear. Flavor is very sweet, loads of apple juice in there. Really nice, refreshing beer/Mead to drink at ease. Short, sweet finish, no carbonation going on.

Pours clear light peach with minimal white head. Aroma of sweet peach, sugar, sake like. Taste is very sweet, fruity, peach and sugar. Body is light, sticky and smooth.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap. Pours deep amber with a small, lacing off-white head. Aroma of honey, cherries, apples, wood and some flowers too. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and quite tart. Medium bodied oily to watery texture and flat carb. A nice Mead indeed.
Draft. A pinkish amber mead. The aroma has notes of honey, cinnamon, and cherries. The flavor is sweet with notes of honey, cherries, apples, and cinnamon, leading to a tart finish.
First time tasting mead. This pours c lear pink-ish, Aroma of cherries and honey. Taste is sweet with a sour note of cherries. I really enjoyed this one.

CBC 2014
Pours clear pink no head
Aromas of cherries, honey, sugar. Some off aroma as well
Fuckin lovely taste of honey, cherries, strawberries

On tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. Light clear pink with a small pale head. Aroma is cherry, apple, rose. Light bodied, sweet and fruity on the palate. Taste is cherry, toffee apple, honey. A little overly sweet.

Draught @ CBC14
Aroma has rose water, some honey tones and hints of root beer. Flavour is sugary sweet with some honey, root beer and apple juice. Like a apple juice with shitloads of sugar.

Draught @ CBC2014, Copenhagen. Pours a clear pale orange colour with a small head. Aroma of cherries, sugar and quite deep honey notes. Flavour of tart cherries, red apples, sweet honey, some citrus and grass. Light bodied and a sharp, tangy, cherry finish. Interesting.

Draught @ CBC 2014


Pours hazy reddish pink with a tiny head. Aroma of sweet fruits, cherry juicy notes and yeast. Taste is juicy, sweet and sticky with some honey, cherry and tartness. Finish is sweet and sticky with some cherry juice notes. Okay mead.

Tap @ CBC14.
Pours clear pale orange color with a minimal head. Aroma of berries, honey, hay and apricot. Sweet honey flavor, grass and some lemon. Very nice and interesting.
5325

Poured from the bottle into a pint glass to drink. The beer had a clear, light peach-straw color with a pinkish hue, plenty of bubbles and a smallish foamy white head with short retention, but pretty good cling and lacing. Its aroma had a tart cherry scent along with yeast and wheat and notes of apple and citrus. The taste was quite sweet with a tart cherry and apple blend along with a cider effect, and a very light sour fruit effect. It was quite crisp and lively with a thinner, dry mouthfeel, good carbonation and a very refreshing character good for hot weather. Better than expected, thank you Siobhan for the Christmas present.
Great beer. Its pink and tasted sweet. Apple cider with honey and tart cherry juice. Lightly carbonated.

Had at the Meadery, the aroma is cherries. Pours a clear light red. The taste is sweet. The body is light, the texture thin, the carbonation average and the finish long. Very Good, could get in trouble with this! Was very careful when I had this.

Reddish/pink pour w/ no head. Aroma is apple, with a little cherry. Sweet aroma. Taste is apple and cherry. Honey brings these together to make a tasty combination. Little tartness. Goes down easy, too easy.

The appearance has a hazy pink color with a ton of bubbles clinging to the sides of the glass. Carbonation rapidly rises, and there isnt any head.
The smell was a combination of sweet honey, tart cherries and apple cider (but really juicy).
The taste was super sweet (whoah, boy is this sweet or what). Apple cider/juice-like watery aftertaste with some wine-like qualities and there is a quick dry finish.
On the palate, its got a sharpness like wine and tries to pound my tongue into submission.
Overall, ok, this is only my second mead to review, but the more I get familiar with this, Im just trying to figure out how this is even "beer." This would be better for wine lovers trying their hand out on the beer side. I, most likely wont ever have this again.
Delicious beer. Almost cheating with all the fruit flavors they add; it's like you'd imagine the elixir of Olympus. Pink color, looks like a rose. Great substitute for wine on a warm day.

Slightly hazy light rose pour. Aromas of apples, cherries, and honey. Flavor is similar. This is delicious! The apples and cherries really add the perfect touch of complexity and tartness to this one. Awesome mead!

[Tap] Darker golden color with lively carbonation. Aroma is moreso of cherry than apple cider or honey. Smooth natural cherry flavors impart mainly sweet notes. Also a mild tart finish. Tasty. Tasting notes from 2/2014.

Has the appearance and mouthfeel of a dry rose champagne. Blend of apple, cherry, and honey. Flavor is slight tart dry rose wine like, but no real residual sugars. Slight cherry adds color but honey and apple dominate (but not overly sweet, maybe in the semi sweet wine category). Enjoyable, but I would not be able to drink much. Hard to put on the scale with beer ratings, but my rating is in the same scale as all my beer ratings. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sweet and tart cherries, light honey and crisp apples. Perfect amount of sweetness. Just enough carbonation and incredibly refreshing.

500mL bottle, pours a clear golden with a small white head. Aroma brings out honey, light cherries and treacle toffee. Flavour is very light in alcohol, yet potent, with moderate honey, lightly tart cherries, and light treacle. Highly sessionable, leaving a lightly sweet and lightly tart finish. Good stuff.
Very cool drink. Taste of apple cider and mead. Apples, cherries,honey comb

500 ml bottle. Pours a pale pink color with no head. The aroma is sort of muddled with soft cherries, and mcintosh apples. The taste is mildly tart with cherries and a bit of apple bringing up the back and providing a nice complexity. The palate is somewhat thin and the carbonation is lively. Finishes long with lingering apples. Overall: Very tasty

Pours a hazy golden honey color. Nose is apples, cherry, apple pie/baked apple, honey. Taste is the same fruits as above, especially getting cherry pie filling on the aftertaste. Tastes a lot like apple cider with cherries added , which I guess it basically is. Somewhat slick mouthfeel from the alcohol. Not bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at Waypoint Public. Purple/gold color with no head. Nose is apple, honey, faint cherry; flavor follows, very sweet, with a slightly sour finish. Very nice.

500ml bottle, thanks to jtclockwork. Pours burnt gold orange with minimal head, a few bubbles. On the nose are apples and tart cherries. In the mouth: this is like juice / sparkling cider. The apple component seems to form the bulk of the base -- cherries on top add a nice fruit punch note, with the blending of fruits and the sweet-tart balance coming to bear. The honey is integrated perfectly so that everything seems unified and balanced in this. Medium body, soft and pleasant carbonation. This may have changed my wifes aversion to mead (well, cyser, but pretty sure neither of us knew what that word even meant before opening the bottle).

Clear orange pour with no head. Cherry juice on the aroma and just faintly sour. Drinks like a candy. Mouth is really light. Taste is sweet and tart all at the same time. Pretty tasty if you are in the mood for a mead.

500 ml bottle- Pours orangeish golden. Aroma is cherry juice more than honey, appealing. The taste is similar, cherry juice and honey, dry finish, you can taste the pits and flesh of the cherry, I wish the honey was more prominent, apples are in the taste which seems odd to me, more cider than mead. Good and refreshing.

Bottle shared at the chriso 2013 pre-GBBF shindig - London. Pours clear, pink-gold. Nice honey sweetness here that isnt overdone, with subtle fruit and cherry accents providing an wisp of tartness. Full bodied. Finishes sweet but not cloying. A nicely drinkable mead.
Bottle poured into tulip glass. Pours a light rose/Orange color. Funky sour aroma. Taste is smooth with honey and cherry the predominant flavors, along with some peach tones. Incredibly tasty

Very sweet. Obviously very strong honey, apple and cherry flavors. Overall pretty decent

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours crisp, clear orange-red color, fizzy but no head retention. Smells like a cider beer with cherry juice. Flavor is more cherry, pie filling variety, sweet and tart in equal measure. Dry aftertaste, a little apple in there. Not my favorite thing but pretty tasty for a cider style.

12 oz pour. Slightly reddish orange. Smell of apples and cherries. Taste is the same with the smoothness added by the honey. Very good for a change of pace but could get really sweet after a couple.

Draft - Pour a light pinkish/yellowish color. Subtle smells of cherries and honey. The taste is smooth with a nice balance of apples, cherries, and honey. From front to back, I could drink this all day.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2016 Tap at the 7th sun brewery... Light pink.. O head... Soft sweet honey fruits nose ... Very light.. Lught sparkle... Sift fruit... Light dry zezt... 3.6

Keg at the banging hat.. Less fizz.. Went down really well +0.2
Draft: Poured a clear pink with white head. Aroma was apple and cherry. Taste was cherry and dry sour apple.
Bottle. Pale pink with little to no head. Aroma of cherries and fruit with a hint of honey. Slightly tart with notes of cherry and a hint of sweetness.
Bottle pours pale pink with quickly disappearing head. Aroma of cherry, pear/apple, grape, sourness. Taste is tart with cherry and apple up front with a clean dry finish.

On tap 6.5 oz. Pour at Carpool in Herndon, VA. 

Clear, yellow-gold with a small off-white head and sparse lacing. 

Aroma of honey, apples, pears, sweet raspberries and light cherries. 

Taste of honey, apples and light fruit. 

Medium/full body and and low/medium carbonization. 

Sweet and easy to drink.
