Clean and refreshing, light cherry flavor. Great clear appearance, reddish tint. I enjoyed it on draft more than the bottle.

First two meads were gross.. Lets try this one. 

Tart wine aroma. Raspberry note. 
Pours a rose color. Minimal bubbles. 
Smooth on the taste. Tart. Cherry notes. Sweet. A little wet on the finish. The best mead Ive ever had. 
Sweet tart and wet on the plate. 

Great mead! I will be checking out more for sure. Plus I can rep the old home state. :)

First ever mead for me. Bottle->snifter. Clear orange-pink with barest hint of a white film, like a rose wine. Aroma: tart cherries and apples. T: same, with honey, peach, cranberry, chardonnay. Nice.

Pours a faint pinkish color with almost no head. It is translucent and reminds me of grapefruit juice from the carton. 					
					
					
					
					It has a very pleasant sour cherry and apple aroma that reminds me of a nice, fresh apple cider or juice. Im no mead expert, but this is smells really nice and crisp, and Im drawn to it almost immediatley.					
					
					
					
					The taste is a really nice, tart cherry flavor with notes of honey, clover, and apple present. Unlike many meads and ciders, this is by no means overly sweet, but it has just enough sweetness. Its really balanced and pleasant, with the right mix of tart and sweet.					
					
					
					
					
					
		 could drink this by the gallon. The drinkability is off the charts.

On tap at Dan's. Man this is great! The are looks like apple juice. The aroma is sweet, with a little cherry on top of what smells like apple peel and almost a bottle of Juicy Juice. The flavor is incredible. I wish there was a more cherry and tartness to it, but it's really, really good. Not too familiar on how the mouth feel is supposed to be with meads, but this is incredible and the aftertaste is brilliant!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig. Reddish gold pour with a small head. The nose is cherry and cranberry smoothie. Nice and dirty. Honey, grain, apples. The taste has a nice, dry tart quality. Soured red cherry. Ocean Spray cranberry juice. Pleasing sweet/tart profile. Medium body, smooth and soft.
Pretty good mead. Would like it to be a little more tart, but all around a good bottle.

Sample at First Sunday. Pours a clear, bubbly pink, with a medium, white head. The aroma is maraschino cherries, honey, and cloves. Light body, crisp, clean mouthfeel, with lots of carbonation. This is a very approachable and delicious mead.

Format: Bottle from World Market, Redwood City
Appearance: Golden rose / blush
Aroma: Honey, apples, maraschino cherry
Taste: White wine, apple juice, honey
Overall: Sweet honeycrisp apples soaked in cherry blossom honey water on a spring day somewhere in the midwest.
A flowery deep cherry scent. Small carbonation and a decent tartness in the mouthfeel. A lot of apple skin and sour cherry flavor. Good stuff. I think the imperial version is much better.
This has been the best mead I have tasted to date...all around perfect...highly recommend.

[Bottle (500ml)] Pours a clear bubbly goldish-pink with a spare white head. Aroma of apples first and foremost followed by honey, a hint of herbs and (possibly because I read there are some) some cherries. Flavour of apples, dry and tart, along with some light sugary sweetness -- the honey perhaps -- and some light cherries. Average bodied. Interesting and enjoyable.
Backlog bottle thanks to so many good ratebeerians. The smell is apple pie, very good, cherry fruit, and honey. The look is clear, no head, legs. The taste is sweet, great, fruits.
draft at Blue Monk, pale pink pour (looks like white zinfandel), medium bodied. very sweet, tart cherries, light cinnamon, touch of apple. Not really my thing but appears to be very well made
Draft. Pours light orange. Fruity. Approachable tart a d sourness. Great flavor. Apple and cherry. Refreshing and easy drinking. solid and flavorful

Tallahassee, Fl - ABC Fine Wine & Spirits - Bull Run - 500 ml bottle. Sparkling medium golden pour with a slight pink hue to it. Aroma is pleasantly sweet with some light cherry accents, a touch of bubble gum, some honey accents. Flavor has a unique sweetness to it, hints of cherry juice, some honey sweetness, a bit of sourness in the back end. Mouthfeel has a nice smoothness to it. Wasnt sure what to expect and wouldnt normally pluck down $11 for a mead - but hit it big on a scratch-off I got at a Christmas Party - so what the heck!
Pours lie rose wine. Aromas of apple and honey. Sweet honey and apple finishes with tart cherry. Refreshing.
Bottle. Pours a bright peach color. Chris and honey on the nose with a bit of effervescence. Quite sweet, but not overpowering. Lots of fruit, especially apple.

Bottle poured a honey pink color with no sediment at all. Aroma has clean fruity honey, mild cherry, and some apple. Mouth feel is light and there is no sugar on the tongue. Flavor has mellow honey, mild fresh cherry, green apples, and a finish that drops right off.

Bottle from Corks & Kegs in Richmond VA. Its clear pink/orange in the glass with no head at all. Apple, honey, and cherries are in the aroma. Lots of apple, much cherry, both the sweetness and earthiness of honey, and a hint of peaches are present in the taste. Its definitely sweet, but I just finished a bottle in 15 minutes and I want another one.
Aroma of fruit and honey, cloudy caramel colour. Taste of apples and honey with a slightly tart finish

peach colored on the pour with no foam....light sweet aroma...a medium viscosity....just right with a touch of sweet....apple cider, honey, and bing cherry essence deep in the sniff....a lambic and a mead had a baby....this stuff!...Ive been told its much better on tap...
On tap. Poured a clear golden color tinted with a pinkish/reddish hue. No head. Apple cider, cherries, honey and fruity. Interesting for sure.
Extremely refreshing. A touch too sweet for my tastes though. The tart cherry juice really helped cut the sweet honey though.
Bottle @ Halling Odense it pours clear golden with no head. this is very nice ! . loaded cherries, apple, honey, tart, . very nice! like this! :)

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2014 Bottle shared by Kingcecil, thanks bro. Clear peach colored body with no head. Apple, candy, honey, cherries, apple aftertaste. Great. RE-RATE Tap at the porch, Key West. Pinkish body with a small white head. Fruity, ripe cherries, apple, some tartness. 7,3,7,3,16

Bottle. Pour light orange amber with no head. Delightful aroma of honey and cherry. Hints of homemade spiced tart applesauce. Taste is SWEET! Initial burst of honey, then cherry. Leave a nice tart flavor. Really nice, but to sweet for multiple glasses.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2013 500ml bottle. Pours a hazy orange with no head. Aroma is sweet with big notes of cherry, white wine, apple, and bubble gum.Taste is sweet with apple, and tart cherries. Medium body with a low carbonation. Oily/slick texture. Syrupy. Overall very nice. Sweet and syrupy.
On tap. Pours a clear reddish gold. Aroma is slight cherry, tart.Taste is a sweet cherry intially followed by a tart finish. Just what you might expect. A nice flavor for this one. Low carbonation.
Bottle. Poured a very pale, pink color, no head at all. Aroma is some pits and skins of cherries. Flavor was cherries. Notes of funk. Cherries. Nice. Very tasty.
Determined quickly that this wasnt for me. Sweet - almost cloyingly so. Overwhelming tartness (which i enjoyed) and sweet, syrupy flavor. Not discounting meads at all...need to try more.

Bottle 500ml. @ [ (chriso Pre-GBBF Shindig) by chriso - London ].Clear medium yellow red pink colour with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate honey, cherry, apple - fruit notes. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light light acidic with a average to long duration, cherry, honey, fruity. IMO quit weird ... Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20130810]

Bottle @ Christers. Pours light reddish golden with a very small offwhite head. Aroma of honey, apples, cherries, wood, flowers, bubblegum. Flavor is honey, apples cider, cherry, flowers, cinnamon, wood. Medium body, soft carbonation. 231013

UPDATED: APR 24, 2015 24.04.2015, 0,5l bottle @ home:
20.03.2013, 0,5l bottle sampled @ BBGTC tasting:
Small bubbly shortlasting head, nice light rosè colored. Aroma is slightly fresh and sweet, yellow apples, honey, grass, apple skin, sugar, hints of cherry stones. Taste is slightly fresh and sour-ish dry, apple cider, grass, honey, yeast, apple skin, minerals, hints of fresh cherries. Slightly dry mouthfeel. Fresh and easy drinking.
Bottle @ Christer. Clear pale pink, almost no head or lacing. Aroma, sweet, honey, cherry, bubble gum, apples, . Taste, sweet, honey, apples, cherry.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy pale orange with a tiny off-white head. Aroma is sweet, apples, honey and cherries. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet finish. 231013
Bottle. Clear peach with tiny head. Aroma is apple, fruit, honey, cherries and spices. Flavour is apples, honey, spices, cherries, fruit, little tart, herbs, medium sweet. Weird.
Bottle. Small head with short duration. Color is light orange. Aroma and taste are chewing gum, honey, apples, fruits and light carbonation. Weird combo, but good.

Appearance is a rich golden red, heavy cloying sweetness, almost tartly cider like in taste with a touch of a bitter finish. $8 a glass it hurts the wallet a bit but its more than worth it with a nice jacked up buzz
500ml bottle. Pours a clear pinkish color. Aroma is mostly of fermented apple. Somewhat tart apple flavor follows with some sweetness. Light to medium bodied. Tasty and refreshing. Quite good.
Shared bottle at craft ale house. Pours clear amber without head. The aroma has honey, cherry and some apple. The taste is huge honey, huge cherry, big apple. Delicious.
Pours a clear amber with an tart aroma of cherries. Taste is tart and sweet, cherries come through nicely along with apple and honey notes. Not my favorite style but solid

Bottle poured into New Glarus flute. Slightly blush peach color with a short-lived fizz. Full bodied cider aroma, deep apple flesh and honeycomb notes, cherries very subtle. In the flavor, sweet candied cherries jump out in the foreground before washing into a smooth sweet cider finish. The honey influence is huge, filling out the palate and lingering for what seems like days. The finish manages to be pretty crisp despite all the residuals. Delicious.

Weve had this on tap at Five Points Growler for a week or so now. Excellent mead from a unique meadery. Subtle cherry aroma with a light pink color--almost that of a Zinfandel. Excellent balance of tart cherry and apple, with tartness prevalent up front and subtle sweetness on the back end. Not much honey. Very light bodied mead-not typical for the style. Only 6% ABV. Overall this really is a kick *** mead and should be on your must-find list.

**Side-Note: finding it on tap at a growler store or on tap will result in a significantly more economical way to enjoy this mead.
Apple cider taste with a bit of cherrys. Almost borderline sour. Very drinkable. Good pour to it no carbonation and pours a light red color a for sure drink again!

Pour was rose colored with some white bubbles It reminded me of a sunset. The aromas here are straight forward but awesome. Sweet cherry and apple aromas. Tastes were an awesome combo of apple juice and cherry syrup. It was almost like drinking Juicy-Juice. Great stuff that is so drinkable want more of this

This poured a purple-ish pink color with no head. The aroma contains some apple, honey, and cherries. The flavor is rather sweet with a strong cherries presence and honey. Some sour apples in the finish. Overall a very nice mead.
pours light amber. apples, cherry, slightly sweet with some light carbonation. very enjoyable.

Bottle @ Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 13. Pours a slightly pale reddish color with a small pinkish white head. Has a fruity spicy cherry aroma with weak hints of honey.Sweetish spicy cherry honey flavor. Has a sweetish fruity spicy cherry finish.
Clear pinkish color, no head/lace/retention. Aroma is apple, honey, sweet, lightly tart. Medium bodied, quite drinkable.

500, capped. Pours a rosy burnished dark gold with no real head or lace. Sweet bright acidic, slightly tart cherry nose, blended perfectly with the honey. Both very pronounced, very forward flavors, but working together very harmoniously. Creamy medium body with a bit of carb. Cherry and honey perfectly integrated on the mid palate, perfectly proportional to one another and very balanced and delightful. Mild sweet cherry finish.

From bottle. Clear pink pour. Apple honey flower cherry aroma. Taste floral honey apple cherry and a bit boozy. Very drinkable and complex sweet but finishes dry. More cider than mead but very good. Thin body.
500 ml. bottle. Clear amber color. Lots of apple aromas, low carbonation. A bit tart, but good flavors of apple, honey with a hint of cherry.
Super awesome cherry cider with tons and tons of honey, thank you SW2013, a very good mead, do it.

Bottle at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2013, 10/08/13.
Clear golden with a moderately sized off white head.
Nose is light sugars, cherry liqeur, touch of booze.
Taste comprises sweet glazed cherries, berry fruit, sugars.
Fullish bodied, fine carbonation, oliy drying finish with a touch of booze.
Decent enough mead.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Poured from a cold bottle. Orange and pink color, mild carbonation. Tart fruit and apple smell. Cherry infused honey deliciousness.
Bottled. Pour hazy cherry color with no head. Smell cherries and honey. Taste cherry, honey, apple cider. So so good!
Bottle from Capitol Beer, Sacramento. Pours clear apple with no head and a honey and cherry aroma. There is a delicious light malt, honey and cherry flavor with a little carbonation.

These beautiful labels randomly popped up at the Co-Op the other day, and even though it was $10 (!!!) Im a sucker to try out new goods, and went for it. Medium-thick mead here, big cherry nose. Tart cherry blended with sweetness of the honey, with an apple note on the tongue towards the finish. Good, but wouldnt buy again - too pricey for a small bottle like that!

Pours a light pink with thin white head. Almost like a champaign? Nose is of sweet tart cherries. Taste is of medium body, balanced carbination of sweet cherries and light molassis. My first mead and pretty damn good.
Midwest Brewers Fest. Poured slight hazy orange pink. Killer aroma of sour cherries. Tastes like an apple pie.

500 ml. bottle. Well, I dont have much experience with Mead or Cyser but here goes anyway It pours a nice clear apple juice color with hints of rose. Fizzy head disappears instantly. Lots of streaming bubbles. The aroma is all apples with milder notes of cherry and subtle notes of honey and yeast. The flavor is delish, but very sweet with apples up front followed by fresh, sweet cherries. Honey is felt more on the palate and a bit in the finish. Medium bodied and goes down easy like a soft drink. Tasty. My wife loves the stuff.

Bottle pour..medium apple juice like color..slight carbonation..nose of quality apple cider spiked with apple pie..good apple combo.also a bit of cinnamon and a trace of tartness..cant say that I know much about mead but the mouthfeel on this is wonderful..smooth bit of honey with obvious cherry sweetness that is kept in check..quite enjoyable and well crafted..

Bottle at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2013. It pours deep amber with a small white head. The nose is juicy cherry, honey, earth, caramel and dried fruit. The taste is juicy cherry, lemon, honey, apple, oily, tangy citrus, light tart edge, date, prune and dried blueberry. Medium+ body, low carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Juicy and well-balanced. I thought this one worked rather well.

Bottle from Taylors Market in Sacramento, CA. Pours rather orange with a pinkish tinged slight white head. Aroma could be cherry and honey. Near med body. Flavor is fairly tart cooking cherry. A little honey, but this is cherry tart. Nice drink. With time the honey seems to get stronger, and Im licking my lips and finding sweet. Still seems tart tho.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2014 Bottle:Apple cider-y, sweet apple skins, light honey, almost no notable booze or alcohol in the aroma or flavor. Very sweet, so be ready for that, but its a nice, delectable treat. If you love apples, youre gonna love this stuff.
Truly amazing. Sweet but addicting. Its amazing what they can do with mead.

On tap at Laser Wolf, Ft. Lauderdale, pours a light cherry red pour. Nose is fruity, and sweet. Taste is very cherry, sweet ( perhaps overly ) but very drinkable. Ends on the same sweet and fruity notes. A nice mead for the mead set of mind. Quaff Score 7 / 10
500ml bottle. Pours a clear pale amber color with a small bubbly white head. Aroma of apples and sweet honey. Taste is sweet apples, tart cherries, honey, and hints of spice.
Bottle shared at ChrisOs pre-GBBF 2013 Shindig. Clear rusty orange amber, white head. Noe is sweet honey, suagary, cherry, pear, syrupy. Taste is sweet pear, apple, cherry, syrupy. Too sweet for me.
Bottle. A clear golden beer with a minimal head. Fruity and sweetish aroma. Fruity and berries flavour.
50 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is apples and light herbal. Sweet fruity, crisp apples. Smooth fruity. Lingering citrusy and crisp fruity finish.
Bottle at Patrick's mansion with Taylor Patrick John-Michael Garrett Ashley and Scott. Pouts light apple. Aroma of pear and apple. Taste is crisp apple juice. Finish us sugary and nice.
500 ml. bottle. Pours a pale red with a tiny white head. Aroma of fruit, honey, and spice. Taste is cherries, apples, honey, and spices. Very nice stuff.
Lots of cherry and apple. Very sweet. Slightly sour. Medium carbonation. Reminded me of serendipity or Belgian red but with less sour.
Bottle from Wine Seller Williamsburg. Pours magenta/blush colored with off-pink head. Nose is cherries, apple, yeast, honey. Tastes of sweet cherry, apple, earthy, with a smooth berry finish.

Bottle. Pours a clear pink color with a few random bubbles at the edges. The aroma has a sweet floral honey wine with nice apple and cherry juice well integrated. The flavor is pretty much what I would expect; sweet honey, lightly floral, cherry and apple juice with a slight tart character to the finish.
Very cherry taste. Light pour at dry hop. Super sweet and not my style but it isn't bad
Rated in April 2012 (Backlog) - Clear with a light pink tint. Aroma is of cherries and booze. Taste is of booze, cherries and berry notes.
Very nice. Well-rounded, awesome drink. Pours amber. Some light carbonation. Nice honey, cherry, apple - great balance. Sweet finish but very tolerable. Great package. Bottle thanks to Chris.
very nice, but as with most cider too sweet for my tastes. a nice refreshing change though.

Pours a pink reddish orange light bubbly with a thin white head. Aroma is of sweet ripe cherrys, honey and fruity. Taste of sweet ripe cherry, some floral honey notes, lightly fruity. Palate is light bubbly, refreshing. Finished with sweet ripe cherrys nicely balanced by some mild floral honey notes on the end. Overall not overly sweet nicely balanced, a good refreshing and enjoyable brew or mead, a nice after dinner drink.
Interesting mead. Organic tart cherries would have been better. Apple cider gives it its edge, but it is malty sweet. Soft drink. Plastic in aroma.Chris bottle.

27 June 2013, bottle. Pinkish water, slightly cloudy. Nose is awesome for a. . . Whatever this is. Cinnamon apple sauce and cherries. Thin body and almost flat. Seriously tastes like store bought apple sauce with moderate cherries. Pretty cool. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a gorgeous rosé color. Fruity aroma. Sweet taste that hangs in your mouth. This is a favorite.

500 ml bottle received in trade. Thank you lionsandbeer! Pours tiny hazy reddish golden with a small fizzy golden head that doesnt leave much trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity with sweetened white bread, red apples, black cherries, honey, hay, cinnamon, apple sauce, dry apple cider, cherry pits, dry wood and hints of sour cherries and cherry hard candy. Taste is sweet and fruity with black cherries, sour cherries, cherry hard candy, sweet apples, cookie dough, honey, lemon zest, cinnamon, cloves and hints of apple cider vinegar and ginger. Mouthfeel is slightly round, tiny sticky sweet, slightly fruity tart and light to medium bodied. Finish is sweet and fruity with apples, cherry hard candy, hay, sweet white bread, cherry pits, sour cherries and honey. Not sure if I love or hate this but its solid, very solid...
quite light for a mead.  also, much more drinkable.   cidery.   cherry juice.   dry.   nice.

Bottle (50 cl), courtesy of _angst_. Clear orange, medium white head. Fruity aroma with cherries, apple and cinnamon. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Semi sweet with some faint acidity. A bit alcopopish.

Bottle at "En liten provning hos larsniclas" hosted by Alex ( _angst_). Pale apricot color, no head. Fruity Apple aroma, cinnamon, honey, sweetish, pear notes. Apple flavor, cinnamon, honey, some alcohol. Fruity sweetish finish with cinnamon and some alcohol.

Reddish gold, no head. Smells like cherry, honey and apple. Taste is lots of fresh fruit, cherries and apple again, with a good dose of honey. Sweet, but not cloying.

Aroma is deceiving! You thinks its gonna be oh just a regular cider. But then you sip and "BAM!" Totally unexpectedly amazing. Aroma is mostly apples and a bit of honey. Pours pinkish tan, aroma is sweet apple cheery, taste is same, awesome drinkable mead!

2013 bottle to a snifter.  Color is a orange and rose blush with no head.  Aroma is a very sweet cherry and honey, almost cotton candy like.  Taste is the same with a little tartness.  Cloying but with a wine like dryness at the end.

A lightly red tinted clear color. Smells of honey, cherry, a little funk and tartness. Very sweet initial honey taste with a good amount of the cherry/apple juice underneath, dry finish. Definitely a white wine quality. A good interesting taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.5l bottle shared with The Tasting Crew. This is a clear pinkish hued peach orange one with a thin quickly sidesticking white top. Smells of cherries, rose water, orange zest, apple wine and grapefruit. It has a soft to average cider carbonation and a surprisingly thin mouthfeel. Cherries, grapefruit, blood oranges. A different hybrid that reminds me a lot of...  well, a soda/alco pop? 20.03.2013

On tap at Ridgewood (Raleigh)

Nice reddish color. Very clear. 

Not much of an aroma. Taste is very sweet, and very good. I am not a fan of meads or hard coders, but this stuff could be very dangerous.  Sweet summer drink with almost no hint of alcohol.

Pours a clear color with a hint of red.  Aromas of cider are very strong.  Tastes like a sweet cider with a small hint of tarn cherries.

Pours clear, bright golden/ bronze with some red and pink notes, beatifull. A small rim and effervescent carb. Aroma is cidery green apples with some red fruits and seasiness. Flavor is cherry just the right ammount of sweetness balanced by a very slight lemony sourness, very gentle but firm cherry aftertaste. Light to medium mouthfeel, refreshing, intense and very enjoyable.
Arome: very cider-y, apple, some caramel. Cloudy orange, cider color. very mild, like a flat cider.

I am new to meads. B Nektars Zombie was very good in my humble opinion. Draft at Coffee District in Delray Beach, FL. American pint glass. Golden amber color with thin white head. Aroma of apples, sweet citrus and honey. Taste was sweet (of course) with apples, honey, and citrus (orange) like sweetness. I didnt get much tart from the cherries. Very refreshing after drinking two stouts and a barley wine.

I havent had too many meads, but this is an exceptional drink. Picked it up in Grand Rapids on the recommendation of one of the employees of a liquor store. The apple and cherry are both apparent, but neither dominates. Sparkling and refreshing.

Bottle. Rusty amber with dense, white foam ring around the edge of the glass and meandering bubbles on the surface. Aroma is sweet and slightly spicy with cherry notes(the spice), apple juice and soft honey (both the sweet). Taste is cherry pie with an apple juice reduction and honey drizzled over it. Sweet but not overdone and the cherry seems more out front than the apple or honey. They come in more on the back end of things. The aftertaste is sweet apples, dry mead notes and beautiful cherry wrapping everything up.  The aftertaste makes my mouth water in anticipation for another sip.  Its was so good, that I wish I was drinking it right now.  Possibly one of the best beverages that I have ever tasted.  Somebody please send me more.
500ml bottle to glass. Smells like a cider. Mead definitely present. Nice cherry undertones. Absolutely refreshing.

500 ml bottle into a brandy snifter.

A - Dark pink body, similar to a blush wine. Thin bubbles around the edge. Leaves an alcoholic trace after a swirl.

S - Really strong apple cider presence followed by a massive wave of tart cherries, cinnamon, vanilla, brown sugar and some honey sweetness. Just an amazing aroma.

T - Tart apple and cherry juice. More of that spice, vanilla, and brown sugar. The aftertaste is very cidery and surprisingly alcoholic. Mouth feel is coating and silky with a dry finish. Has a very slight effervescence to the feel due to the tratness of the apples.

O - The aroma is just perfect. If they made a pine tree car scent with this aroma I would wear one around my neck all day. Very refreshing and highly drinkable.

Bright, crisp, clean - everything you need to kill zombies! Pours a light rose color, nice legs when swirled. Nose is mostly apple and honey. Taste is beautifully balanced with sweetness from the honey and apple and the tartness of the cherry. Very nice!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy orange pour.  Smells like dry fruit wine.  Thin mouth feel, no lacing to speak of.  Lots of honey flavor in this mead with tart cherry/apple tastes.  Sweet finish, more of the same: honey and dry wine.

Poured from a bottle into a wine glass. Pours a pale rose with not much in the way of a head. Aroma is tart cherries with some green apple characteristics. I dont pick up much in the way of honey here. Taste is really heavily influenced by the cherry juice. Finishes sweet and just a little tart. Really liked this. I could drink it all day.

Bottle.  Pours a clear garnet tinged ruby amber with a faint white to pink ring of foam.  Bright cherry pie, soft and juicy on the nose.  Medium bodied, cherries and light sweetness. Moves into a nice tart cherry flavor with some acid.  Light and tart, nice acid with a good cherry backbone.  Very faint honey hints, and a touch of apple crispness, but a lot of that is probably because Im looking for apples and honey.  Aside from that though, this is remarkably delicious.  Soft cherry finish with a nice sweetness before a tart turn into a gentle acid.  Really tasty stuff.

draft.  no head with a clear, still pink peach body. faint nose of apple, cherry and pear juice; moderately sweet and lightly tart. mix of sweet and tart candy-ish fruit (jolly ranchers) is quite simple. medium acid, medium bitterness with some chalk/calcium sweettart candy character (definitely not close to the tartness tasted from actual fruit). quenching acid is probably the highlight, but otherwise its very cider and soda-like (lacking any honey character or mead-like smoothness). pretty one-dimensional, though refreshing, theres little to get excited about.  Im perplexed by the high ratings.

Big thanks to my sister, ratebeers 15_2_Kuhnhenn. This pours clear pale peach with light pink-ish hues. The aroma offers up cherries and raspberries as well as some tartness. The taste is cherry and then moves into cherry and cranberry apple juice. To midway and into the finish it takes on increasing fruity tartness. Nice stuff but it seems a bit like fruit juice rather than anything else.

B. Nektar did it again. The guys at B. Nektar know their stuff. This may be my new favorite from B. Nektar. The cherry is sweet but there is a good tartness to this drink. Too many cherry drinks are sweet but this with its tart has to be one of my best things my taste buds have ever had!!!
pale pink with no head. nearly perfect balance of honey sweetness and cherry tart. best mead i have had to date.
Bronze/Honey in color with a deep cherry aroma. Very sweet almost like a Reisling wine and scarily smooth going down. If you want your lady to try beer, this is it.
on tap @Cajun Sourfest-pours pink/orange with a fizzy white head.  Aroma is sweet medium fruit, honey, light malt.  Taste is sweet medium fruit-cherry, honey, light malt, herbal.

Bottled.  Poured translucent, very, very light peach with the tiniest ring of bubbles around the edges.. really cool color to it.  The aroma picked up tart apples first, with tangy cherry skins, white grapes, and a touch of oak showing not long after.. very fruity and intriguing.  The flavor found moderately sour cherry, apple, and white grape skins throughout.. loved the cherry through the finish, and it had a light afterkick of tasty apples.  Lighter-bodied with a little prickly carbonation on the edges.. crisp, refreshing, and well-balanced.. excellent stuff!

Small pour on tap at Bad Apple (Chicago, IL). Pours a richly golden lightly haze pour, loose bubbly head is small, dies to minimal size and laces minimally. Rich deep amber hue, glowing orange and deep sunfire. Aromas offer firm apple cider, dry and a touch yeasty, with a distinct dry mellow sweet apple touch, faint honey. Touches of cherries grow with some tart slant to them, some gentle sweetness from the honey, more dry apple elements linger with spice. Initial is medium bodied, offering a melange of cider, apples, and cherries. Tart and dry as we get further in, Touches of sweetness jab in and out in the middle, honey and honeycrisp apples. Cider slant gives it a unique take, a bit lighter and champagney dryness give some girth, cherries remain a bit more tart than sweet. Pretty enjoyable.
Bottle to pint. Looks good; light, pink, and carbonated. Smells and tastes like watermelon. Average mouthfeel. I cant figure out if this is honey wine or cider...or wine...
From the bottle. Reddish orange pour with no head. Fresh cherry and honey aroma. Light honey and tart cherry taste. Light and refreshing mead.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2012 Refrigerated 0.5 L bottle 6% poured into a white wine glass.  Pours clear with a pink hue and white head that dissapates quickly.  No lacing, medium body, slightly syrupy texture, light carbonation, and very light cherry/sweet aroma.  Taste is apple cider, honey, and slightly tart cherry.  The marriage of apple cider and mead with a hint of cherry, nicely balance of the flavors.  Super easy to drink great on a summer day.

500 mL bottle.  Pours a clear reddish copper with some carbonation.  Aroma is fruity with cherries as expected, something spicier like black licorice or potpourri, making it a bit like raspberry.  Flavor is nicely flavored with cherries, raspberry-like again, with a touch of sticky honey blending in.  Hints of apple, too.  Quite tasty.

From notes: Poured a pinkish champagne color with no head and mild carbonation bubbling.  Aroma is very mild.  Dont really get the honey, but mostly apple juice and tart cherry.  Body is light, yet still somewhat syrupy.  Flavor of sour cherry mixed with crisp apple.  The honey appears in the finish and lingers nicely.  Very drinkable, as the apple and cherry prevent the honey from getting too cloyingly sweet.

Poured from a 500 mL bottle into a tasting glass.

Zombie Killer pours a light, mostly transparent peach raspberry color, with just a gentle suggestion of bubbly carbonation, but no cap to speak of.

The mead comes through in the nose first.  A nice sweet honey presence   preempts sweet cherries and some apple tartness.

There is a simple elegance to the flavor that I definitely appreciate.  The honey sweetness, semi-sweet but semi-tart cherries, and tart apples all play off each other nicely, resulting in a sweet cyser that is not over the top.  The finish is nice and clean.

It is definitely worth noting just how refreshing this is on the palate.  Even though it mostly lacks carbonation, it is light enough where the flavors seem to skate along my tongue.  The tartness toward the end of the sip causes me to salivate a bit, in a good way.  It cannot be overstated how smooth this is.

I am definitely impressed with my first offering from B. Nektar.  This balanced cyser is worthy of the rave reviews it has been getting from anyone who has tried it.

Pours pink into snifter, no legs. Aroma is mostly cider with some cherries pretty simple. Taste is complex, tart cherry and apple cide notes that get balanced out by the sweetness of the honey, seems like a perfect mead and cider mix.

$8 bottle from Liquor Land in Dorchester. 6% ABV on label. Poured into an Ommegang chalice.

Color caught in between pink & peach. After the initial burp, it sits pretty still.

Smells prominently of cherry skins & tart cider, with some yeast & sulfites on the trail.

Taste is waxy, with a generous amount of cherry. Half tart apples bring up the back end, but the pie filling continues through. Absolute finish dries out with some grain flavor.

Body has some slight thickness & a light buzz of carbonation. Kind of like half flat soda.

This is probably the best cherry cider Ive every had. Doesnt cut it as a mead though. Quite silly & stubborn of whomever is in charge to keep this bottle listed in the directory. Though I am obviously just as weak willed, taking the opportunity to seek it out & rate it. :P Tasty.
user_location: FT: Stale Polotmavý in Queens, New York, USA

text: (bottle - 500 ml) Pinkish red pour with a fluffy and light pink head. Aroma is full of sweet and fruity notes. Cherry, honey and apple are most predominant. Amazingly sweet and smooth flavor. Lots of cherry with a nice and sweet honey apple middle and followup. Great all around.

Bottle thanks to travita. Pours with a very pale, peachy hued body with a small white head. Aromas are of cherries, plastic, honey, medium alcohol, and a bit of stone fruit. Flavors are sweet, pie cherries, grassy. Light fruit, a bit of apple. Medium sweet throughout, medium bubbles, lighter bodied.

500ml bottle shared by Doug, thanks 
Appearance: Clear pink/red with some legs 
Aroma: Honey, sweet cherries and apples 
Taste: Sweet cherries, honey and green apples 
Very nice, crisp and smooth, easy drinking.

500 ml bottle thanks to Bigmmartin. Pours a beautiful pink hue with some legs, looks like a wonderful wine. A sweet fruity nose with both apples and cherry apparent, some light vanilla. The flavor is awesome; all the richness of a Ice Cider in a lower gravity form: sweet fruity flavor mix between a ripe apple and tart cherries, very well made, something like vanilla. Very drinkable, insanely so. Damn good. I need a flagon of this.

Pale pink and clear.  Aroma:  Prominent cider aromas, tart apple and cherries, some white wine notes. Tart apple, tannins, cherries. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
500 ml bottle thanks to Doug. Spicy apple, soft honey, cherries-slightly tart.  Very easy to drink. The balance is great, not overly sweet or tart. Glad I got to try this.
Pours a clear thin red. Nose and taste are big on the tart cherries which is well cut with the honey sweetness. A good drink but way over hyped.

Date: April 20, 2012
Mode: Draft
Source: Duckworths, Park Road
Appearance: clear pale gold
Aroma: sweet honey aroma, light fruityness
Body: big body
Flavor: sweet honey flavor, light fruityness, light fruity tartness
Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 8/10; Overall: 13/20
Rating: 3.3/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: **+ /4

Nice, though it took a minute for this to really sink in. The nose was very light and restrained but closer examination revealed a nice soft honey tone. Color was a pink salmon type color, light effervescence. Flavor was semi-sweet honey up front, light and restrained, light mouthfeel, hints of sour cherry and a semi-dry finish. In the end the honey notes were light but quite pleasing, and the cherry added a nice touch.

Shared by someone at the Montes Krown tasting yesterday.  Ok, this is the first mead Ive ever had, and I gotta say, if all meads are this good, consider me a huge mead fan.  Pours a clear light pink.  Slightly funky and sour in the nose.  A bit sweet and cloying in the mouth, but has a nice sour/funk that I can get behind.  Pleasant.

Pale cherry.  The aroma is light cherry and hints of mead.  Balanced and clean with light fruitiness.  Very light carbonation.  Sweet honeyish finish with light fruitiness.  Not a ton of complexity, kind of an introductory mead.  A little to populist for my tastes.
Not sure what I expected with this one but doesnt disappoint. Interesting cherry, cooked/caramelized apples, with very faint honey. Quite refreshing. Nicely balanced, not overpowering tart or sweet.

Pours a nice rose color with no head to be seen, but nice side clinging bubbles.  Aromas of cherries, sweet apples and hint of floral notes.  I thought the flavor was gonna be sweeter and Im glad it wasnt.... the flavor profile follows the nose with nice hints of sour cherry, ripe apple and a bit of floral rosey notes that have a similar winey flavor of a fruit heavy rose  Great summer session drink... enjoying now on a 70˙ day after working in the garden. Cheers
Pours clear very pale pink color. Aromas of cherries and apples. Tart cherry and sweet apple flavors with honey and white wine. Medium body with no carbonation. Nice and refreshing.

Thanks to travita for sharing this bottle. Pours a light yellow color with some pink hues. The aroma is full of cherries and honey. The flavor is more of the same, with the addition of some nice vanilla and oak notes. Medium mouthfeel. Very nice.

Poured from a 16oz bottle.  Pours the color of a blush wine with no head at all.  Aroma is champagne and some cherry.  Taste follows the nose.  This is a very dry beverage with some tartness and sweetness balanced out.  It is like a nice dry apple or pear cider, but the tart cherries really bring out something interesting.  I could use a few more of these for the summer.

Bottle, thanks to tnudish, 05/08/2012.  Pours rosé with a copper tinge, a few bubbles.  Aroma is moderately sweet, with honey, tart cherry notes on top, other light fruit.  Taste is much more honey-forward with tart apple, cherry finish.  Light palate, very drinkable, slightly sticky.  Enjoyable.

500 ml bottle sent by a friend in Wisconsin. Pours a clear, rose-tinted pale gold with rising carbonation bubbles and an initially finger fizzy head that dissipates quickly. Clean aroma of fresh cherries, apples, honey, and a hint of apple pie spice. Flavor of fresh cherries, apples, honey, chardonnay, and mild spices. Clean, crisp, and refreshing, but with a ton of fresh, sweet, fruity flavor. High carbonation, light body. Great stuff.

Bottle at redlight. Blush colored, chill haze. Aroma rich with summery ripe red cherries, chardonnay yeast. The effervescence is mild, making it almost flat with a little lightness on the tongue. The palate is bursting, just bursting, with fresh bing cherries. Finishing resinous and clean. Lots of fun but very well made, so it's personality has a wonderful balance. Serious when it needs to be, and playful all the time. Great!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a golden red with little to no head. Aroma is sweet notes of fruit but mostly honey. The taste is great honey notes at first with a sweet and tart finish. notes of cherries and apples. Flat on the palate but very smooth and easy to drink. I could throw these back all day if they werent so expensive.
(500ml bottle, courtesy of travita)  Pours a still clear pale pink.  Aroma of cherry, apple, honey,  and perfume.  Flavor of cherry, honey,  light funkiness, and apple.

Sample at the Big Tap In after-party at Vintage Estates on 04/21/2012. This Mead pours a grapefruit pink color with a minimal head and decent legs. Aroma of cherries and honey. Light to medium body with a mildly tart cherry and apple character. Some sweet honey and molasses in the background. The finish is fruity with a cherry aftertaste. Solid Mead all around.

hazy gold, thin white bubbled head. Nose is lightly oxidized, honey, flat, not much fruit. Flavor shows more sweet melon and sugary grape at front, mid is more biscuit,  honey sweetness returning through finish. Thick, sweet, but very smooth, the high, integrated sugar is a problem only if its a flavor issue. Not much cherry throughout, sugar overwhelms it.

Little to no aroma, beautiful deep clear magenta color. Cherry taste with a bubbly palate. Slightly lingering finish. Loved this cider. Fun and fruity, sweet and bubbly. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap. Pinkish pour with no head. Aroma and taste elements of cherry, apple, and grape. Super good stuff.
Bottle from travita.  Pink pour with no head.  Aroma is sweet and cherry.  Taste is just a little alcohol, a little cherry, and apple juice.  Sweet finish.
bottle, thanks to travita, clear  color, very decent cherry and fruits flavors with a good bready note

(500ml bottle thanks to travita) clearish pink and light bubbles. Tart cherries, light tart apples, braeburn and other apples with a touch of alcohol. Taste of tart cherries, honey, tart/sweet apples. Medium body with light carbonation. Sweet but good.
The appearance is a pink/red color, fizzy.  The flavor is sweet cherries, vanilla.  The aroma is the same.  Medium in body.  Sweet finish on the palate.  High carbonation.  Very good.

From bottle served into snifter.  Pretty strong fruity aroma.  Clear pink color with very minimal head.  Heavy sweet taste with the strong cherry flavor coming through.  Very light body with a thin texture with a cherry finish.  Overall a wonderfully unique beer that is very easy to drink.  Definitely a new favorite of mine.

4/6/12. On tap. Clear pink pour with a small ring of pink, fizzy head thats gone fast. Nice sweet and tart cherry aroma with a touch of sweet honey. Very nice tart cherry flavor with some sweet honey, but lots of cherry. Nice!

Bottle shared with friends. Clear blush pour with no head. Aroma of cherry, apple and honey. Sweet cherry and tart apple flavor blended nicely with a carbonated finish. Not super complex, just nicely done.

[Bottle, thanks Daknole!] Pours peach colored with no head. Aroma is not that impressive--weak, and just vaguely sweet. The taste is much better. White wine, cherry, almost a light spice character (cinnamon) at times. There is also honey, and honeycrisp apple. No sign of any alcohol. Good mouthfeel, smooth, fairly long finish. Light carbonation. I really have had a hard time rating this one. Very well done, and dangerously easy to drink. While it isnt something I was amazed by, I definitely enjoyed it and could drink a lot of it. Thanks again, Daknole!

Bottle. Clear pinkish white grapeskin color.  White grapes, Chardonnay, tart cherry skin, and slight honey sweetness.  Light honey, some floral notes, slightly sweet but clean and vinous in the finish and very tasty. Medium to lighter body with very fine carbonation.

Tap. Pours clear, dark peach with a trace of fizzy white head. Aroma is peaches, cherry coke, cookie malt, green apples, and honey. Flavor is heavy fruit esters with light supporting malt; sweet finish. Medium body, low carbonation, and low warmth.

Tap at Maxs.  Pours clear ruby with no head.  Aroma is cherry, apple, light dry grass/straw with honey notes.  Flavor is light cherry and dry grass/straw with honey notes and a dry finish.  Medium to light body, low warmth and carbonation.

2012.04.02 - on tap at Always Ron's.  After pour it looks very much like a raspberry ginger ale soda or similar.  Taste is a bit tart at first but as your tongue adjusts it is fairly sweet with tart aftertaste.  Pretty good.

Bottle.  Pours a clear gold with a slight tinting of pink with just a touch of effervescence.  The aroma is honey, clean and sweet, with supporting notes of apple and cherry.  The flavor is initially cherry, which is followed by apple and then the honey rises at the finish.  It is very interesting that all three components seem to climax at different times.  This stuff is so easy to drink and is so enjoyable, I am kicking myself for not buying more when I was in MA.

Im not usually a fan of meads, but this drink was outstanding. The body, even without a head, looked great - reminded me of a sunrise. Scents were just straight cherries and apples with a subtle honey twang. The taste was about the same, but so much of fresh cherries and honey with a damn near perfect tart finish. I could drink this all day! Thanks to OmegaX for this incredible elixir.

Bottle from Knightly Spirits. Pour was rose colored with some white bubbles from a vigorous pour. It reminded me of a sunset. The aromas here are straight forward but awesome. Sweet cherry and apple aromas. Tastes were an awesome combo of apple juice and cherry syrup. It was almost like drinking Juicy-Juice. Great stuff that is sooo drinkable. A crowd pleaser.

Draft at Fermentation Lounge. Pours a very clear rose color with a tiny white head. Aroma of sweet honey and jarred cherries. Sweet honey and red apple entry with a very light carbonation that livens it up a bunch finishing with nice amount of tart cherries. Good stuff.

Bottle shared by Ant. Poured a, uhm, well, assuming mead isnt supposed to have a head then this poured fine I guess, bascially a dense clear gold body sums it up. Aroma of cherry, honey and some sweet wax. Smooth bodied with a tinge that reminds me of carbonation. Flavor is sweet, soft honey notes along with a hint of cheries. Good stuff.

Clean pinkish amber pour with no head.  Bright aroma with sweet honey notes and green apple acidity and a vanilla like almond note from the cherry.  Refreshing acidity with the flavor with a very light sweetness and cherry flavor.
Mead shared at redlight, aroma of weak cherry and apple, very wet and sweet, this is Delicous, very smooth and awesome.

Clear amber pour with slight rosey hints. Not head, but hints of carbonation in the body. Big cherry and apple notes, but not acetaldehyde. Lots of honey sweetness and fresh wheat peasant bread. The flavor is other worldly! Massive, pronounced, succulent, juicy, vibrant, quenching, and tart. Big sour cherry mixed with honey, white grape juice, and apple juice. Medium body with bright tartness and a quenching finish. Amazing!

Very pretty light pink/roseate pour with touches of amber. Nose holds really cool grainy elements, slightly sour cherry, apple skin, grape must, and sweet riesling notes. Flavor is absolutely stupendous! Beautiful cherry sweetness akin to New Glaruss really great fruit beers, but great complexity from the apple, honey, and not even remotely cloying. Ultra refreshing; I could drink this by the gallon on the patio on a hot sunny day. DAMN. Really really good.

500mL. Pours a clear rose champagne with brilliant clarity. Quick white foam. Champagne look. Nose is also rose champagne with white grape notes taken over by sweeter cherry pie. Very fresh and subtle with no sugar or plastic character. Taste is tangy and sweet with a quenching, clean palate. Hints of orange blossom honey and lime with tart cerise noire. Very much, for a non wine lover, like an upgrade from plasticy, bland champagne. Immensely enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

In bottle at 7vth Sun, poured a sparkling light peach color with aromas of dry cider, apples, cherry and honey.  Flavor hits you in the mouth with cherry juice, which is out of this world, then the sweetness of the honey takes over and it has a slightly dry finish.  Real nice mead, I was turned off by meads for a while, but this one might have drawn me back in.  Need to find more of this to enjoy at home on a nice hot summers evening.

Bottle shared by emacgee. Thanks dude.  Pours a clearish orange with some pink tint.  no head but its mead.   Smells very fresh and appley, mild cherry tartness and just a touch of honey.  Flavor is slightly tart and acidic with cherry fruit upfront ending more sweeter with the honey and sweeter apples showcasing.   A sweettart in mead form.  delicious.

500ml bottle, shared with mom. ABV listed as 6% on the bottle. Completely clear peach color, zero head. Interesting hue. Nice, light crisp carbonation. A very nice and drinkable light mead... Very fresh tasting, almost refreshing! Would be a good one for warmer weather, I think. Its kind of like a cider, but much more complex... The honey / apple / cherry combo works very well, here, and has a nice aftertaste. Sweet taste. An interesting and refreshing mead; my mom liked it.
(bottle from rayl101).  Pours a clear pink color with light carbonation.  More cherry aroma.  Taste is sweet, but not over the top.  Light cherries.  Sticky and sweet.  Just friggin great!

Pours a slightly golden pink color. Light apple aroma up front, floral honey right behind.  Flavor is similar,  with the apple qualities leading the charge, honey with the middle section and a slightly tart cherry component on the finish.  The light carbonation puts this one over the top, in a very good way.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2013 Pours a crystal clear rose/honey color with a very thin white/pink head.  Aroma is like white wine with notes of cherry and pear.  Flavor brings out more cherry and some apple...somewhat less winey than the aroma...more sweet...bit of honey.  Mouthfeel is very light and slightly lively with a sweet, fruity finish.

[4203-20111218] 500mL bottle. Mild apple cherry juice aroma. Clear, light pink orange body with a quick bubbly head. Apple cherry juice flavour is quite light and fruity. Light body. Nice light cider, great label! (6/2/6/3/14) 3.1
(w/ jerc, others)

Pours a bubbly slightly red tinted liquid. smells of cherry, cider and mild floral honey. Taste is sweet honey with a tart cherry and notes of cider. some yeasty champagne like esters. overall semi-sweet and light bodied. Overall enjoyable drank that is indeed refreshing. Those who I shared it with were impressed and pleased.
Bottle from Martys Hops and Vines. Orange ish pour. Honey and sweetness countered by some tartness and cherry. Honey dominates, of course. Nice.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2012 I got to try this last night at the homebrew club meeting, thanks for the opportunity Joel!
Pours a clear light pink color with a smattering of white on top that dissipates almost immediately. Smells of tart and sweet cherry juice with a hint of apple. I know this is a mead but I have trouble finding the honey underneath the tart cherries. Taste is fairly sweet up front, hits with some apple and tart cherry midway then finishes fairly dry with a lingering cherry sweetness. Medium to light body with a light level of carbonation and a sweet tart mouthfeel. This is one damn tasty beverage! I find it drinks more like a cider than a mead though.
pinkish orange body...clear...aroma of honey and some tart cherry juice..flavor is just as simple, but is equally sweet and tart, with apple coming through in the finish..crisp and refreshing

Light cotton-candy pour with zero head.  Like baking an apple and cherry pie in double ovens.  Lots of cinnamon infused apple with bright cherry skin and sweet honey.  Clean and not at all cloying.  Yum!
Pink pour.  Aroma is apples, honey, tart berries.  Tart, sweet, fruity aroma...apples, cherries...fucking A this is seriuosly an awesome brew.  WOW!

This is a fantastic mead. I had it on tap at my house in November, it starts of with a pleasant apple aroma that slowly turns to tart cherries, little honey aroma is present. the appearance is beautiful. crystal clear with a soft pink rocky head that dissipates quickly the color is a nice pale pink. the flavor is rather complex  at the beginning   you get a great crisp apple flavor that slowly moves to a tart Michigan cherry flavor which is then paired with a smooth creamy flavor of star thistle hone. all in all an amazing balance of acidity and honey, great meld of flavors and a great product. if you see this mead on the shelves pick it up, you will not be disappointed

16oz pour. pale pinkish pour with no head at all and carbonation.  the initial aroma of cherries and apples. incredible blend. the flavor changes as it goes from cold to cool...the warmer it gets the more the honey flavor blends. but the sourness of the cherries mixed with apples is spot on and turns into an incredible flavor. then the honey makes it sweet on top of it all. very very good mead.

Bottle thanks to mikem409, pours a golden/pink with some bubbles but no head. Aroma of apples and cherries. Taste of sweet cherries and dry tart apples balanced nicely with sweet honey. Usually not a fan of meads to them being overly sweet but this has a great balance and is just delicious.

From a 500ml bottle with no freshness date. Poured into a shaker glass, unfortunately. 

A: I know this isnt a beer, but this doesnt look very appealing, especially in a shaker glass. Crystal clear body almost champagne colored, a really pale amber with slight pink even. No head to speak of.

S: I dont care much for the scent, tarty cherries, but this reminds me more of a wine than anything, then again Im not used to meads.

T: Wow, this tastes way better than I was expecting, very sweet upfront with a very apple cider taste. Very clean flavor with the cider leading into the tart cherries rather quick with good balance. Theres a slight sweetness from the honey, but its very light. I couldnt drink this every day, but I definitely would love this with dinner instead of a wine.

P: Light to medium bodied with sharp carbonation that feels like little stabs on the tongue here and there. Very lively.

O: Im enjoying this, I picked it up for my girlfriend but its a nice change up from hoppy IPAs and thick stouts. This reminds me a lot of a more balanced Cerise in ways, though its probably because of the cherries.
Aroma of champagne, sour cherries and cider.  Tastes sweet of cherry and apple.  Very carbonated and sweet.  Very easy to drink!

Bottle. 16.9 oz. Split with Sean and Vinnie, courtesy of Vin. Pours a soft, clear flush pink with a bit of bubbles and an immaculately clean surface. Aroma of fresh apples, red cherries, cinnamon, honey, and traces of cabernet wine grapes. Mouthfeel is very sublte, sweet, and crisp; flavors of light cherry pie, fresh dough, and cinnamon abound with a soft, white winey finish. Very good cider/mead hybrid.

From a bottle severed in a snifter. Pours a clear pink body with no head Smells very sweet with both the aromas of cherries and apples. Can tasted both the cherries and apples with the cherries at the front and apples at the end. Almost feels like a wine in the mouth. Makes me want to try more mead.
Pours golden pink into a tulip. Head quickly subsides to nothing. Sweet honey and tart apple aromas. Spritzy with sweet apple and honey upfront before turning to tart cherry in the lasting finish.

Growler fill from Maxs Taphouse, courtesy of Simon. Poured a light pink color with small head and lacing. Aromas of champagne, cider, granny smith apples, rich dark cherry, vanilla, wood, and lavender. Taste is sour apple, wine, brown sugar, cinnamon, cherries.  Reminded me of a candy apple. Sticky palate, warming and somewhat refreshing. I enjoyed it cold but tons of extra flavors and scents came out once this baby warmed. Excellent mead

Bottle to snifter. Pours a blushy pink with a couple quick bubbles. Aroma is faint sweetness. The taste is awesome tart cranberries, cherries and a sweet apple cider that comes off sour and acidic. Palate is thin and acidic with a chalky dry tartness that makes you want more. This is really nice, everyone should try this!
Pinkish body very little head. Aroma and taste of cider fresh apples honey with slight cherry finish. A must weapon to add to aresinal against the undead baddies.
Pours pink, no head, very sweet, rich with tastes of cherry, and a smack of apple cider, with light tastes of honey. No body to it, but for the style, it is very appropriate. Thanks B. Nektar.

Bottle; Pour is fairly clear - with a pinkish wine like consistency. Mild head that does vanish fairly clearly. The nose is honey sweetness, cherry skins and cherry juice, and apples. The flavor profile shares these elements, but I suppose I was hoping for slightly more body to this one, i.e. it feels a little thin thanks to the juice fusions - there is a slight tartness present , with more apples and slight bready malts.

2011-12-18.  Pinkish yellow bubbly body. Zippy apple and fruit in the aroma. 7+ Flavour is similar, zippy apple with mild cherry overtones, sweet core. Average to light bodied palate. Quite quaffable and enjoyable, but I was expected more depth and richness considering the previous high ratings. Nice stuff, regardless. Bottle from Champanes, Michigan

Bottle.  Clear light pink pour, plenty of lasting effervescent carbonation (although no head) and a slightly sweet aroma.  Flavor is very light and slightly tart cherry, thin honey and finished crisp like an apple.  Would buy this by the case if it wasnt 8 bucks a bottle.

[Bottle] shared by DalzAle. Thanks Greg! Pours a clear, peachy pink with a soda-like carbonation. Aroma is like dry cherry 7-Up - light cherry, dry apple, very light floral honey. The flavor has the sweetness that I was expecting to find in the aroma. There is a substantial cherry flavor, semi-sweet apple cider character, delicate floral honey character. Still, its much more like a soda than an alcoholic beverage. Very sessionable, minus the price tag!
Draft in a snifter. Pours golden with light white head. Nose is sweet white wine. Aroma is andre brut champagne. Very sweet. Fizzy. Makes me want to get plastered in Aquitaine.

Ive never had anything like this and it was really really good.  Pours the look of beringer white zin box wine.  Aroma smells like cherry apple cobbler.  Really inviting and fruity.  Taste is medium sweetness with great fruit flavors and nice spice elements.  I could drink this all the time if it was more accessible.  GREAT

excellent flavors. 500 ml bottle just picked up. Great cherry juice. Tastes like i just bit into an apple pie. The finish is tart, the apple juice in there is stellar. I am new to meads but this is so rediculously tasty, makes me want to try others. Cheers!
Bottle. Pours pinkish red - like a zinfadel. Nose/taste of apple and cherry juices, honey, vanilla and light oak. Very easy drinking. Smooth. Light to medium body.  Well-balanced slightly sweet mead.

Bottle - Pours clear pink with no head at all. Nose is sweet honey, white grape, sweet apple, and a touch of vanilla and sweet cherry. Taste is a blast of honey sweetness that transitions into a tart cherry finish...wow. Really sweet and decadent, but the finish cuts off abruptly so it doesnt linger with crazy sweetness. Syrupy and smooth body with no carbonation. Wow...awesome stuff.

Picked up a 500 ml bottle at the B. Nektar meadery near Detroit, Michigan. Pours a clear pink light white zinfandel colored cider/mead with a clean disk and no viscosity tears. Aroma of tart cherry, a hint of cider and very faint honey. Taste is light to medium bodied, cider/tart cherry and a hint of candi sugar. Finish is when the cherry really shines and has a slight lingering aftertaste that is pretty decent. Even served cold this cherrry cyser is quite refreshing.

Bottle. Poured clear reddish pale color with good legs. Moderate tart fruit, honey and small alcohol aroma. Medium to full body with a thick smooth texture and long legs. Medium tart fruit and honey flavor with a medium to heavy complex sweet finish of moderate duration. Pleasing smooth alcohol burn. Good mead.

Bottle.  Aroma has notes of green apples, honey, cherries, jolly ranchers and flowers.  Pale pink hue.  Flavor is very sweet and medium sour.  Palate is medium bodied and watery tart with a very soft carbonation.  Overall a really delicious brew that I would never get tired of.
bottle...really light color, looks like a watered down white zin... the aroma is light cherries, sweet, candy... tastes good, but all juice, might as well be drinking juice, crushable but boring

500ml bottle purchased here in the city.  glad to see this getting distributed here in chicago... opens with a small hiss and yields a chardonnay like hue with a light tint of pink, a rose pink petal quality to it with a minimal ring around the colar soapy white head... the mead imparts itself into the aroma with a honey sweetness while a light cherry mingles effortlessly with it.  the majority though seems to be focused on the cider nature of this mead.  apple crisps, honeycomb, and marachino cherries all combined into one.  an apple focused kiddie cocktail, ha.  a touch sweet but there is mead involved so there... flavors do nothing as to persuade one in a different direction.  cidery for sure with a light apple vinegar bite that offers a touch of acidity.  cherry adds a layer of complexity while the mead offers up a mild degree of sweetness that eventually cuts short due to the light dryness of the cider.  light and easy to drink.  too easy to drink almost.  a belgian red light with apple cider and honey accents.  chicks will dig it, think you will too.

Bottle:  The aroma consists of apple cider with some honey and lightly tart cherries.  It pours a dull light pink, bordering on peach colored, with some large soapy white bubbles that quickly fades to a very fine ring around the edges of the glass.  The flavor starts with lots of tart apples with the finish leaning more towards tart cherry.  Theres a touch of honey sweetness in the background, but its definitely the tartness of the apples and cherries that dominates.  Medium bodied with mild carbonation.  Overall, extremely refreshing and drinkable.  At $9 a bottle, its just going down way too quick.  This would be an expensive habit.

Bottle. Pours a clear reddish amber with a small white head that dissipates completely. Aroma has a good amount of tart cherries with a hint of backing honey. Flavor starts with honey but is balanced by a nice cherry tart note. Quite drinkable.

Opened up a box that was sitting on the floor at belmont party supply and I was surprised to see something from b nektar. Since when do they distribute to ohio? I may need to go buy the rest of these. Pours a light pink color with a few bubbles. Aroma was apples and cherries. The honey added a nice sweetness to this that was balanced very well with the tart cherries. I havent had many cysers but this one is defintely the best so far.

Bottle in Detroit. Crystal clear, light pinkish appearance with no head. Sweet honey, mild apple, light cherry aroma. Slightly syrupy mouth feel. Somewhat spicy, cherry pie-like, rich honey flavor with a fairly tart cherry finish. Fuck this is good.
Pours pale pink, with a small ring of fine bubbles. Aroma is huge cherry, with notes of apple cider. flavor is much the same. Body is light & crisp.

Bottle. Thanks Mike! Pours a clear, pinkish hued color. Apple. pineapple, cherry, and strawberry in the nose. Light mouthfeel. Super cherry pie all the way. Sweet, cherry, with a bit of apple cider acidity to it. Very tasty. Smooth and drinkable. No appearance of alcohol.
dont usualy drink mead but gave this one a try. blush color and bubbly taste is like apple cider and cherry juice very very refreshing

At GTMW, but was the dry hopped version.  The mead pours to a blush colored wine.  The aroma was pretty much cherry honey and light piney hops.  The flavor was cherry wine, blush wine, light honey.  Honestly, tasted more like a wine than a cyser.  Very well done.  Hops were subtle.  Very easy drinking palate that hides the high ABV.  I preferred the B. Nektar Meadery Funky Monkey (I had it as Belle Isle Belgian-style melomel).

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2016 Bottle... Farewell to ibrew2or3... Clear pink/rose mead. I really struggled, to no avail, to smell anything at all and came up with only a trace of cherries. Full-bodied and oily with modest carbonation. The flavor is fruity with heavy sweetness and medium acidity. Finishes sweet, then acidic and fairly dry. Bottle courtesy of meadme!

Thanks to askofficerfriendly for the share.  Pours a clear champagne yellow with a small white head.  Nose is sweet apples, honey, sweet and tart cherries, and honey.  Flavor is similar with an effervescent quality which cleans up nicely.  A bit drier than I would have imagined, but a very enjoyable mead.  The blend of flavors mixed with the carbonation makes this beer a balanced, enjoyable experience.
Busy Bee Raleigh.   Spritzy carbonation.  honey, cherries,  lightly tart and sweet.  a wonderful mead

UPDATED: APR 19, 2012 Love the guys at B. Nektar and to think this one could be on draft one day in Florida makes me downright giddy.

Pours nice and light fizzy light champagne.  Aromas of fresh fall cider, and tart cherries.  Flavors of lightly spiced cider, a yin and yang of sweet and tart cherries, and a hint of sugary sweetness.  Sort of a different take on a blend of Belgian Red Raspberry tart blend.  Zippy carbonation made this one uber refreshing on a hot summer night.  Wonderful flavors makes this downright crushable.  My favorite beer (uh mead) of a very large tasting consisting of tons of rare and hyped brews.  

Keep on Keeping on Brad!  You guys rock!!

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2014 The best mead Ive ever had, by a long shot.  Nicely crisp carbonation, slightly tart and slightly sweet cherries, just tasted like a really great craft cherry soda with some tartness thrown in for good measure.  Awesome balance, thanks Greg!

2nd for beer of the night.  Thanks to Askofficerfriendly, danka.  Didnt take notes and drank many, many different brews so Im not able to hit on tasting notes aside from crisp, cherries, apple, and yum.
